option.name: fileSummaryMaps
option.value: {"D:/DO_AN/doan/Audio_E-commerce":"{\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/entity/StoreWallet.java\":\"This file defines the `StoreWallet` entity, which represents a wallet associated with a store in an e-commerce application. The entity has various fields to track the store\\u0027s available balance, deposit balance, pending balance, and total revenue, as well as the associated transactions.\\n\\n`StoreWallet`: An entity that represents a wallet associated with a store, containing information about the store\\u0027s financial balances and transactions.\\n\\n`walletId`: A unique identifier for the store wallet, generated using a UUID.\\n`store`: A one-to-one relationship with the `Store` entity, representing the store associated with this wallet.\\n`availableBalance`: The available balance in the store\\u0027s wallet.\\n`depositBalance`: The deposit or security balance in the store\\u0027s wallet.\\n`pendingBalance`: The pending balance in the store\\u0027s wallet.\\n`totalRevenue`: The total revenue generated by the store.\\n`createdAt`: The timestamp when the store wallet was created.\\n`updatedAt`: The timestamp when the store wallet was last updated.\\n`transactions`: A one-to-many relationship with the `StoreWalletTransaction` entity, representing the transactions associated with this wallet.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/entity/PlatformTransaction.java\":\"This file defines a JPA entity class `PlatformTransaction` that represents a transaction in an audio e-commerce platform. The class has several fields to store information about the transaction, such as the wallet, order ID, store ID, customer ID, amount, transaction type, transaction status, description, and timestamps for creation and update.\\n\\n`PlatformTransaction`: A JPA entity class that represents a transaction in an audio e-commerce platform.\\n\\nThere are no functions defined in this file. The file is focused on defining the structure and properties of the `PlatformTransaction` entity class.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/service/PlatformFeeService.java\":\"This file defines an interface for a `PlatformFeeService` that manages the platform fees for an audio e-commerce application.\\n\\n`PlatformFeeService`: An interface that provides methods for creating, updating, retrieving, and listing platform fees.\\n\\n`create(PlatformFee fee)`: Creates a new platform fee.\\n`update(UUID id, PlatformFee fee)`: Updates an existing platform fee.\\n`getActiveFee()`: Retrieves the currently active platform fee.\\n`getAll()`: Retrieves a list of all platform fees.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/dto/response/WalletTransactionResponse.java\":\"This file contains a single class:\\n\\n`WalletTransactionResponse`: A data transfer object (DTO) that represents a wallet transaction response, containing information such as the transaction ID, wallet ID, order ID, transaction type, status, amount, balance before and after the transaction, description, and the transaction creation timestamp.\\n\\nThis file does not contain any functions. It is a simple DTO class used to represent the response data for a wallet transaction.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/AudioECommerceApplication.java\":\"This file is the main entry point for the Spring Boot application \\\"AudioECommerceApplication\\\". It enables asynchronous processing and starts the Spring Boot application.\\n\\n`AudioECommerceApplication`: This is the main class that bootstraps the Spring Boot application.\\n\\n`main(String[] args)`: This is the main method that runs the Spring Boot application.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/service/StoreKycService.java\":\"This file defines an interface called `StoreKycService` that provides methods for managing the KYC (Know Your Customer) process for stores in an e-commerce application.\\n\\n`StoreKycService`: Provides methods for managing the KYC process for stores.\\n\\n`submitKyc`: Submits a KYC request for a store.\\n`approveKyc`: Approves a KYC request.\\n`rejectKyc`: Rejects a KYC request with a reason.\\n`getAllRequestsOfStore`: Retrieves all KYC requests for a specific store.\\n`getRequestDetail`: Retrieves the details of a specific KYC request.\\n`getRequestsByStatus`: Retrieves KYC requests by their status.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/repository/PlatformTransactionRepository.java\":\"This file contains a Java interface named `PlatformTransactionRepository` that extends the `JpaRepository` interface. The purpose of this interface is to provide a set of methods for querying and managing `PlatformTransaction` entities in a database.\\n\\n`PlatformTransactionRepository`: An interface that provides methods for querying and managing `PlatformTransaction` entities in a database.\\n\\n`findByStoreId`: Retrieves a list of `PlatformTransaction` entities based on the provided `storeId`.\\n\\n`findByStatus`: Retrieves a list of `PlatformTransaction` entities based on the provided `TransactionStatus`.\\n\\n`findByType`: Retrieves a list of `PlatformTransaction` entities based on the provided `TransactionType`.\\n\\n`findByDateRange`: Retrieves a list of `PlatformTransaction` entities based on the provided date range.\\n\\n`filterTransactions`: Retrieves a list of `PlatformTransaction` entities based on the provided filters (store ID, customer ID, transaction status, transaction type, and date range).\",\"/src/test/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/AudioECommerceApplicationTests.java\":\"This file appears to be a test class for the `AudioECommerceApplication` class. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather a single test method `contextLoads()` that is used to ensure the Spring Boot application context can be loaded successfully.\\n\\nThe file serves as a basic integration test for the `AudioECommerceApplication` class, which is likely the main entry point for the audio e-commerce application.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/entity/Enum/RoleEnum.java\":\"This file defines an enumeration called `RoleEnum` that represents different roles in an audio e-commerce application.\\n\\n`RoleEnum`: An enumeration that represents different roles in the audio e-commerce application, such as ADMIN, GUEST, STAFF, CUSTOMER, and STOREOWNER.\\n\\n`getValue()`: A method that returns the integer value associated with each role in the `RoleEnum` enumeration.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/config/OpenApiConfig.java\":\"This file is a Spring Boot configuration class that sets up the OpenAPI (Swagger) documentation for the Audio System application.\\n\\n`OpenApiConfig`: This class configures the OpenAPI documentation for the application.\\n\\n`api()`: This method creates an `OpenAPI` instance with the necessary security requirements and information about the API.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/entity/Enum/WalletStatus.java\":\"This file contains an enumeration (enum) named `WalletStatus`, which represents the different states a wallet can have in an audio e-commerce application.\\n\\n`WalletStatus`: An enumeration that defines the possible states of a wallet, including `ACTIVE`, `INACTIVE`, and `LOCKED`.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/service/Impl/WalletServiceImpl.java\":\"This file is an implementation of the `WalletService` interface, which provides functionality for managing customer wallets and their transactions.\\n\\n`WalletServiceImpl`: Implements the `WalletService` interface, providing methods for managing customer wallets and their transactions.\\n\\n`getByCustomer`: Retrieves the wallet for a given customer ID.\\n`deposit`: Performs a deposit transaction for a given customer ID and transaction request.\\n`withdraw`: Performs a withdrawal transaction for a given customer ID and transaction request.\\n`payment`: Performs a payment transaction for a given customer ID and transaction request, handling idempotency.\\n`refund`: Performs a refund transaction for a given customer ID and transaction request.\\n`listTransactions`: Retrieves a paginated list of wallet transactions for a given customer ID.\\n`doChangeBalance`: Handles the core logic for updating a wallet\\u0027s balance and creating a new wallet transaction.\\n`toWalletResponse`: Maps a `Wallet` entity to a `WalletResponse` DTO.\\n`toTxnResponse`: Maps a `WalletTransaction` entity to a `WalletTransactionResponse` DTO.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/dto/request/AddressCreateRequest.java\":\"This file contains a single class:\\n\\n`AddressCreateRequest`: A data transfer object (DTO) that represents a request to create a new address for an e-commerce application.\\n\\nThe file does not contain any functions. Instead, it defines the structure of the `AddressCreateRequest` class, which includes various fields such as the receiver\\u0027s name, phone number, address details, and whether the address should be set as the default.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/repository/CustomerAddressRepository.java\":\"This file contains a single interface `CustomerAddressRepository` that extends the `JpaRepository` interface provided by Spring Data JPA.\\n\\n`CustomerAddressRepository`: An interface that provides CRUD operations and custom query methods for the `CustomerAddress` entity.\\n\\n`findByCustomerIdOrderByIsDefaultDescCreatedAtDesc(UUID customerId)`: Retrieves a list of `CustomerAddress` entities for the given `customerId`, ordered by the `isDefault` field in descending order and the `createdAt` field in descending order.\\n\\n`findByIdAndCustomerId(UUID id, UUID customerId)`: Retrieves an optional `CustomerAddress` entity with the given `id` and `customerId`.\\n\\n`countByCustomerId(UUID customerId)`: Counts the number of `CustomerAddress` entities for the given `customerId`.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/dto/request/UpdateStoreStatusRequest.java\":\"This file contains a single class:\\n\\n`UpdateStoreStatusRequest`: A data transfer object (DTO) that represents a request to update the status of a store.\\n\\nThis file does not contain any functions. The purpose of this file is to define a DTO that can be used to update the status of a store in an audio e-commerce application.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/entity/Enum/StoreWalletTransactionType.java\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. It defines an enumeration called `StoreWalletTransactionType` that represents different types of transactions related to a store\\u0027s wallet, such as deposits, pending holds, release of pending funds, withdrawals, refunds, and manual adjustments.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/dto/response/StoreResponse.java\":\"This file contains a single class:\\n\\n`StoreResponse`: A data transfer object (DTO) that represents the response for a store in an audio e-commerce application, containing information such as the store\\u0027s ID, name, description, logo, cover image, address, phone number, email, rating, status, and associated account ID.\\n\\nThis file does not contain any functions. It is a simple DTO class used to transfer store-related data between the application\\u0027s layers.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/repository/PlatformFeeRepository.java\":\"This file contains a single interface `PlatformFeeRepository` that extends the `JpaRepository` interface provided by Spring Data JPA.\\n\\n`PlatformFeeRepository`: An interface that provides methods for interacting with the `PlatformFee` entity in the database, including finding the active `PlatformFee` record.\\n\\n`findByIsActiveTrue()`: A method that returns an `Optional` containing the active `PlatformFee` record, if one exists.\",\"/src/main/resources/templates/email/welcome_admin.html\":\"This file appears to be an HTML template for an email or web page that welcomes an admin user to a website. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather displays a greeting, a link to the admin console, and a closing message.\\n\\nThe file performs the following tasks:\\n\\n1. Displays a greeting to the admin user, using a variable `${name}` to insert the user\\u0027s name.\\n2. Informs the user that their admin account has been created.\\n3. Provides a link to the admin console, using the variable `${siteUrl}` to construct the URL.\\n4. Includes a closing message from the \\\"AudioEcommerce\\\" team.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/dto/response/CustomerResponse.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `CustomerResponse`, which is a data transfer object (DTO) used to represent a customer\\u0027s information in an e-commerce application.\\n\\n`CustomerResponse`: A DTO class that encapsulates the relevant information about a customer, including their personal details, account status, loyalty program information, and order history.\\n\\nThis file does not contain any functions, as it is a simple data class used to transfer customer data between different parts of the application.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/entity/Enum/ProductStatus.java\":\"This file defines an `Enum` called `ProductStatus` which represents the different statuses a product can have in an audio e-commerce application.\\n\\n`ProductStatus`: An enumeration that represents the different statuses a product can have, such as `DRAFT`, `ACTIVE`, `INACTIVE`, `OUT_OF_STOCK`, and `DISCONTINUED`.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/service/Impl/DomainProvisioningService.java\":\"This file contains a service class `DomainProvisioningService` that handles the creation of customer and store entities in an audio e-commerce application.\\n\\n`DomainProvisioningService`: A service class that ensures the creation of customer and wallet entities, and optionally creates a default store for store owners.\\n\\n`ensureCustomerAndWallet`: A transactional method that creates a customer and a default wallet if they do not already exist for a given account.\\n\\n`ensureDefaultStore`: An optional transactional method that creates a default store for a store owner account if it does not already exist.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/dto/request/UpdateQtyRequest.java\":\"This file contains a single class:\\n\\n`UpdateQtyRequest`: A data transfer object (DTO) that represents a request to update the quantity of an item.\\n\\nThis file does not contain any functions. It simply defines a DTO class with a single property, `quantity`, which represents the new quantity to be updated.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/dto/response/AccountResponse.java\":\"This file contains a single class:\\n\\n`AccountResponse`: A data transfer object (DTO) that represents the response for an account, containing the user\\u0027s email, full name, and role.\\n\\nThis file does not contain any functions. It is a simple DTO class used to encapsulate and transfer account-related data between different layers of the application.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/entity/Enum/WalletOwnerType.java\":\"This file defines an enumeration called `WalletOwnerType` which represents the different types of wallets in an audio e-commerce system. The enumeration has three values:\\n\\n`PLATFORM`: Represents the platform\\u0027s intermediate wallet that holds all the money before it is released.\\n`SHOP`: Represents the individual wallet for each shop.\\n`CUSTOMER`: Represents the customer\\u0027s refund wallet.\\n\\nThis file does not contain any classes or functions, but rather defines an enumeration that can be used throughout the application to represent the different types of wallets.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/entity/Account.java\":\"This file defines the `Account` entity class, which is used to represent user accounts in an audio e-commerce application.\\n\\n`Account`: This class represents a user account in the audio e-commerce application, with fields for the user\\u0027s name, email, password, phone, and role.\\n\\n`name`: The user\\u0027s name.\\n`email`: The user\\u0027s email address.\\n`password`: The user\\u0027s password.\\n`phone`: The user\\u0027s phone number.\\n`role`: The user\\u0027s role, which is an enumeration of possible roles (e.g., \\\"ADMIN\\\", \\\"CUSTOMER\\\").\\n`store`: A one-to-one relationship with the `Store` entity, representing the user\\u0027s store (if they have one).\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/dto/request/UpdateComboRequest.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `UpdateComboRequest`, which is a data transfer object (DTO) used to update the information of a product combo in an e-commerce application.\\n\\n`UpdateComboRequest`: A DTO class that holds the updated information for a product combo, including the category ID, basic information, media, shipping details, pricing, and a list of included product IDs.\\n\\nThis file does not contain any functions. It is a data transfer object used to update the information of a product combo in an e-commerce application.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/repository/StoreKycRepository.java\":\"This file contains a repository interface for the `StoreKyc` entity, which is used to manage the KYC (Know Your Customer) process for stores in an e-commerce application.\\n\\n`StoreKycRepository`: This interface extends the `JpaRepository` interface and provides methods for interacting with the `StoreKyc` entity in the database.\\n\\n`existsByStore_StoreIdAndStatus`: This method checks if a `StoreKyc` entity exists for a given store ID and KYC status.\\n\\n`findByStore_StoreIdOrderByCreatedAtDesc`: This method retrieves a list of `StoreKyc` entities for a given store ID, ordered by the creation date in descending order.\\n\\n`findByStatusOrderBySubmittedAtDesc`: This method retrieves a list of `StoreKyc` entities for a given KYC status, ordered by the submission date in descending order.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/dto/request/CreateComboRequest.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `CreateComboRequest`, which is a data transfer object (DTO) used to represent the request data for creating a new combo product in an e-commerce application.\\n\\n`CreateComboRequest`: A DTO class that holds the necessary information for creating a new combo product, including the store ID, category ID, product details, images, shipping information, and a list of included product IDs.\\n\\nThe file does not contain any functions, but rather defines the structure and properties of the `CreateComboRequest` class using Lombok annotations for generating getters, setters, constructors, and a builder pattern.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/dto/request/StoreKycRequest.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `StoreKycRequest`, which is a data transfer object (DTO) used to represent the request data for a store\\u0027s KYC (Know Your Customer) process.\\n\\n`StoreKycRequest`: A DTO class that holds the necessary information for a store\\u0027s KYC process, including the store name, phone number, business license number, tax code, bank details, and URLs for identity documents and business license.\\n\\nThis file does not contain any functions. It is a simple DTO class used to encapsulate the data required for a store\\u0027s KYC request.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/controller/StoreWalletController.java\":\"This file contains a Spring Boot REST controller class for managing a store\\u0027s wallet transactions.\\n\\n`StoreWalletController`: A REST controller class that provides APIs for managing a store\\u0027s wallet, including retrieving the current wallet information, listing wallet transactions, and filtering wallet transactions based on various criteria.\\n\\n`getMyWallet()`: Retrieves the current wallet information for the authenticated store.\\n\\n`getMyWalletTransactions()`: Retrieves a paginated list of wallet transactions for the authenticated store, with optional filtering by transaction type.\\n\\n`filterTransactions()`: Filters the list of wallet transactions for the authenticated store or a specified wallet, based on various criteria such as time range, transaction type, and transaction ID.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/email/EmailTemplate.java\":\"This file defines a single class, `EmailTemplate`, which is used to represent an email message with a recipient, subject, and HTML content.\\n\\n`EmailTemplate`: A class that represents an email message with a recipient, subject, and HTML content.\\n\\nThe file does not contain any functions, only the definition of the `EmailTemplate` class.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/controller/ProductComboController.java\":\"This file contains a Spring Boot controller class for managing product combos in an e-commerce application.\\n\\n`ProductComboController`: A controller class that provides various endpoints for creating, updating, disabling, and retrieving product combos.\\n\\n`validateActiveStoreAndGetId()`: A helper function that validates the active status of the store associated with the current user and returns the store\\u0027s ID.\\n\\n`createCombo()`: Endpoint for creating a new product combo.\\n\\n`updateCombo()`: Endpoint for updating an existing product combo.\\n\\n`disableCombo()`: Endpoint for disabling an existing product combo.\\n\\n`getComboById()`: Endpoint for retrieving the details of a specific product combo.\\n\\n`getAllCombos()`: Endpoint for retrieving a list of all product combos, with optional filtering and sorting.\\n\\n`getMyCombos()`: Endpoint for retrieving the product combos associated with the currently logged-in store.\\n\\n`getProductsInCombo()`: Endpoint for retrieving the list of products included in a specific product combo.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/controller/UploadController.java\":\"This file contains a Spring Boot REST controller class for handling image uploads to Cloudinary.\\n\\n`UploadController`: A REST controller class that provides endpoints for uploading single and multiple images to Cloudinary.\\n\\n`uploadImage`: A POST endpoint that accepts a single image file and uploads it to Cloudinary, returning the URL of the uploaded image.\\n\\n`uploadImages`: A POST endpoint that accepts multiple image files and uploads them to Cloudinary, returning a list of URLs for the uploaded images.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/dto/response/ProductResponse.java\":\"This file contains a single class `ProductResponse` which is a data transfer object (DTO) used to represent the response of a product in an e-commerce application. The class has various fields that capture the different aspects of a product, such as its identification information, basic information, images and videos, pricing and discounts, status and ratings, and various product-specific attributes for different types of audio products (speakers, headphones, microphones, amplifiers, turntables, and DACs/mixers/sound cards).\\n\\n`ProductResponse`: A DTO class that represents the response of a product in an e-commerce application, containing various fields to capture the different aspects of the product.\\n\\n`BulkDiscountResponse`: A nested class within `ProductResponse` that represents the bulk discount information for a product.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/entity/BaseEntity.java\":\"This file defines a base entity class for an audio e-commerce application. It includes the following:\\n\\n`BaseEntity`: A base class that provides common properties and behaviors for all entities in the application, such as a unique identifier, creation and modification timestamps, and a flag to indicate if the entity is active.\\n\\n`id`: Generates a unique UUID identifier for the entity.\\n`isActive`: Indicates whether the entity is active or not.\\n`createdAt`: Records the timestamp when the entity was created.\\n`updatedAt`: Records the timestamp when the entity was last modified.\\n`deleteAt`: Records the timestamp when the entity was deleted.\\n\\nThe file also includes annotations and configurations for the entity, such as the use of the `@MappedSuperclass` annotation to make this class a base class for other entities, and the use of the `@EntityListeners` annotation to enable auditing functionality.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/exception/ExternalApiException.java\":\"This file defines a custom exception class called `ExternalApiException` that extends the `RuntimeException` class. It is used to handle exceptions that occur when interacting with external APIs.\\n\\n`ExternalApiException`: A custom exception class that represents an error that occurred while interacting with an external API.\\n\\n`ExternalApiException(String message)`: A constructor that creates a new `ExternalApiException` instance with the provided error message.\\n\\n`ExternalApiException(String message, Throwable cause)`: A constructor that creates a new `ExternalApiException` instance with the provided error message and the underlying cause of the exception.\",\"/src/main/resources/templates/email/kyc_rejected.html\":\"This file appears to be an HTML template for a KYC (Know Your Customer) rejection notification email. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather a structured HTML document with placeholders for dynamic content.\\n\\nThe file performs the following tasks:\\n\\n1. Displays a greeting to the store owner with their name.\\n2. Informs the store owner that their KYC application has been rejected.\\n3. Provides the reason for the rejection.\\n4. Includes a link to the KYC page for the store owner to update and resubmit their application.\\n5. Closes the email with a signature from the AudioEcommerce team.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/email/EmailTemplateType.java\":\"This file defines an `enum` called `EmailTemplateType` which represents different types of email templates used in an audio e-commerce application. The `enum` includes the following values:\\n\\n`EmailTemplateType`: An enum that defines the different types of email templates used in the application, such as account welcome, account creation, KYC submission, KYC approval, KYC rejection, order confirmation, and password reset.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/repository/CartItemRepository.java\":\"This file contains a single interface:\\n\\n`CartItemRepository`: This interface extends the `JpaRepository` interface and is responsible for providing CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations for the `CartItem` entity, which is identified by a `UUID` primary key.\\n\\nThe file does not contain any classes or functions. It defines a repository interface that allows for the management of `CartItem` entities in a database using the Spring Data JPA framework.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/entity/Enum/CustomerStatus.java\":\"This file contains an enumeration (enum) named `CustomerStatus`, which defines the possible status values for a customer in an audio e-commerce application.\\n\\n`CustomerStatus`: An enumeration that represents the different status values a customer can have, such as active, inactive, suspended, or deleted.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/entity/PlatformWallet.java\":\"This file defines a `PlatformWallet` entity class, which represents a wallet associated with a platform, shop, or customer in an e-commerce application. The class has several properties that track the wallet\\u0027s balance, transactions, and ownership details.\\n\\n`PlatformWallet`: An entity class that represents a wallet associated with a platform, shop, or customer in an e-commerce application.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/repository/StoreWalletTransactionRepository.java\":\"This file is a Spring Data JPA repository interface for managing `StoreWalletTransaction` entities in an e-commerce application.\\n\\n`StoreWalletTransactionRepository`: This interface extends the `JpaRepository` interface and provides methods for querying and filtering `StoreWalletTransaction` entities.\\n\\n`findByWallet`: Retrieves a list of all `StoreWalletTransaction` entities associated with a given `StoreWallet`.\\n\\n`findByWallet_WalletId`: Retrieves a paginated list of `StoreWalletTransaction` entities associated with a given wallet ID.\\n\\n`findTop1ByWallet_WalletIdOrderByCreatedAtDesc`: Retrieves the most recent `StoreWalletTransaction` associated with a given wallet ID.\\n\\n`findByWallet_WalletIdOrderByCreatedAtDesc`: Retrieves a paginated list of `StoreWalletTransaction` entities associated with a given wallet ID, ordered by creation date in descending order.\\n\\n`findByWallet_WalletIdAndTypeOrderByCreatedAtDesc`: Retrieves a paginated list of `StoreWalletTransaction` entities associated with a given wallet ID and transaction type, ordered by creation date in descending order.\\n\\n`filterTransactions`: Retrieves a paginated list of `StoreWalletTransaction` entities based on various filter criteria, such as wallet ID, creation date range, transaction type, and transaction ID.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/controller/StoreController.java\":\"This file contains a Spring Boot controller class for managing store-related operations in an e-commerce application.\\n\\n`StoreController`: A REST controller class that provides endpoints for managing stores, including retrieving store details, updating store information, and changing store status.\\n\\n`getStoreById`: Retrieves the details of a store by its unique identifier (UUID).\\n\\n`getStoreByAccount`: Retrieves the store associated with a specific account (identified by its UUID).\\n\\n`updateStore`: Updates the details of a store, such as the store name, description, logo, cover image, address, phone number, and email.\\n\\n`updateStoreStatus`: Updates the status of a store (e.g., active, inactive, pending, rejected).\\n\\n`getAllStores`: Retrieves a paginated list of all stores, with the ability to search by a keyword.\\n\\n`getMyStoreId`: Retrieves the UUID of the store associated with the currently authenticated user.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/entity/Enum/WalletTransactionStatus.java\":\"This file defines an enumeration called `WalletTransactionStatus` that represents the possible statuses of a wallet transaction, such as `PENDING`, `SUCCESS`, `FAILED`, and `CANCELED`.\\n\\nThere are no classes or functions in this file. The file simply defines an enumeration to represent the different states of a wallet transaction.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/repository/CartRepository.java\":\"This file contains a single interface `CartRepository` that extends the `JpaRepository` interface provided by Spring Data JPA.\\n\\n`CartRepository`: An interface that provides methods for interacting with the `Cart` entity in the database, including finding a `Cart` by a `Customer` and a `CartStatus`.\\n\\n`findByCustomerAndStatus`: A method that retrieves an `Optional` of a `Cart` entity based on the provided `Customer` and `CartStatus`.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/controller/TestController.java\":\"This file contains a Spring Boot REST controller class with three API endpoints.\\n\\n`TestController`: A REST controller class that provides three API endpoints for testing authentication and authorization.\\n\\n`publicApi()`: A public API endpoint that can be accessed without authentication.\\n\\n`privateApi(Authentication authentication)`: A private API endpoint that requires a valid authentication token to access.\\n\\n`testRole(@AuthenticationPrincipal org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.User user)`: An API endpoint that tests the user\\u0027s roles and displays the username and authorities.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/service/Impl/ProductServiceImpl.java\":\"This file contains a single class `ProductServiceImpl` that implements the `ProductService` interface. The file also includes annotations for Jackson JSON serialization and Lombok for generating boilerplate code.\\n\\nThere are no explicit functions defined in this file. The file serves as a data model for the `StoreKyc` entity, which can be used in the application\\u0027s persistence layer.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/service/Impl/ProductComboServiceImpl.java\":\"This file contains a single class `ProductComboServiceImpl` that implements the `ProductComboService` interface. system.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/config/SecurityConfig.java\":\"This file is a Spring Security configuration class that sets up the security settings for an e-commerce It performs the following tasks:\\n1. Retrieves the user\\u0027s email and name from the OAuth2 user attributes.\\n2. The `ShippingMethodRequest` class is a data structure that holds information about a shipping method, such as its name, code, logo URL, base fee, fee per kilogram, estimated delivery days, support for cash-on-delivery and insurance, activity status, description, contact phone, and website URL.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/service/StoreKycService.java\":\"This file defines an interface called `StoreKycService` that provides methods for managing the KYC (Know Your Customer) process for stores in an e-commerce application.\\n\\n`StoreKycService`: Provides methods for managing the KYC process for stores.\\n\\n`submitKyc`: Submits a KYC request for a store.\\n`approveKyc`: Approves a KYC request.\\n`rejectKyc`: Rejects a KYC request with a reason.\\n`getAllRequestsOfStore`: Retrieves all KYC requests for a specific store.\\n`getRequestDetail`: Retrieves the details of a specific KYC request.\\n`getRequestsByStatus`: Retrieves KYC requests by their status.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/repository/CustomerOrderRepository.java\":\"This file contains a Java interface named `CustomerOrderRepository` that extends the `JpaRepository` interface from the Spring Data JPA library. The purpose of this interface is to provide a set of methods for interacting with the `CustomerOrder` entity in a database.\\n\\n`CustomerOrderRepository`: An interface that provides methods for querying and managing `CustomerOrder` entities in a database.\\n\\n`findByExternalOrderCode(String externalOrderCode)`: Retrieves a `CustomerOrder` entity by its external order code.\\n\\n`findByCustomer_Id(UUID customerId, Pageable pageable)`: Retrieves a paginated list of `CustomerOrder` entities associated with a specific customer.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/dto/request/ConfirmSuccessRequest.java\":\"This file contains a single class:\\n\\n`ConfirmSuccessRequest`: A data transfer object (DTO) that represents a request to confirm a successful audio e-commerce transaction, including information about a photo URL, whether the product was installed, and a note.\\n\\nThis file does not contain any functions. It is a simple DTO class used to encapsulate the necessary information for a successful audio e-commerce transaction confirmation.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/entity/WarrantyReview.java\":\"This file defines an entity class `WarrantyReview` for an audio e-commerce application.\\n\\n`WarrantyReview`: An entity class that represents a warranty review, which includes a rating, comment, and the date it was created.\\n\\n`pre()`: A pre-persist method that sets the `createdAt` field to the current date and time when a new `WarrantyReview` entity is created.\\n\\nThe file also includes the necessary annotations and imports for the `WarrantyReview` entity class, such as `@Entity`, `@Table`, `@UniqueConstraint`, `@Getter`, `@Setter`, `@NoArgsConstructor`, `@AllArgsConstructor`, and `@Builder`.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/repository/WarrantyRepository.java\":\"This file contains a single interface `WarrantyRepository` that extends the `JpaRepository` interface provided by Spring Data JPA. The `WarrantyRepository` interface defines several methods for querying and managing `Warranty` entities in the application\\u0027s database.\\n\\n`WarrantyRepository`: An interface that provides methods for interacting with the `Warranty` entity in the application\\u0027s database.\\n\\n`findBySerialNumber(String serialNumber)`: Finds a `Warranty` entity by its serial number.\\n`findByCustomer(Customer customer)`: Finds all `Warranty` entities associated with a given `Customer`.\\n`findByEndDateBeforeAndStatus(LocalDate date, org.example.audio_ecommerce.entity.Enum.WarrantyStatus status)`: Finds all `Warranty` entities that have an end date before the given date and a specific status.\\n`findByStoreOrderItemId(UUID storeOrderItemId)`: Finds all `Warranty` entities associated with a given store order item ID.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/dto/request/SellBannerCreateRequest.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `SellBannerCreateRequest`, which is a data transfer object (DTO) used to represent the request data for creating a new sell banner in an e-commerce application.\\n\\n`SellBannerCreateRequest`: A DTO class that represents the request data for creating a new sell banner, including the title, description, banner type, active status, start and end times, and a list of banner images.\\n\\nThe file does not contain any functions, but rather defines the structure and properties of the `SellBannerCreateRequest` class using Lombok annotations for generating getters, setters, constructors, and a builder.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/LangChain4J/ProductAiQueryController.java\":\"This file appears to be a Spring Boot controller class that handles product-related AI queries.\\n\\n`ProductAiQueryController`: A REST controller class that provides an endpoint for searching products based on a given question.\\n\\n`searchProduct`: A function that takes a question as input and returns a list of product IDs that match the query.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/repository/PlatformCampaignRepository.java\":\"This file contains a Java interface named `PlatformCampaignRepository` that extends the `JpaRepository` interface from the Spring Data JPA library. The purpose of this interface is to provide a way to interact with the `PlatformCampaign` entity in the database.\\n\\n`PlatformCampaignRepository`: This interface provides methods for interacting with the `PlatformCampaign` entity in the database, including checking if a campaign with a specific code already exists, and filtering campaigns based on various criteria.\\n\\n`existsByCodeIgnoreCase(String code)`: This method checks if a campaign with the given code (ignoring case) already exists in the database.\\n\\n`filterCampaigns(CampaignType type, VoucherStatus status, LocalDateTime start, LocalDateTime end)`: This method filters the list of `PlatformCampaign` entities based on the provided criteria, such as campaign type, status, start time, and end time, and returns the filtered list in descending order of start time.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/repository/GhnOrderRepository.java\":\"This file contains a single interface `GhnOrderRepository` that extends the `JpaRepository` interface provided by Spring Data JPA.\\n\\n`GhnOrderRepository`: An interface that provides methods for interacting with the `GhnOrder` entity in the database.\\n\\n`findByStoreOrderId(UUID storeOrderId)`: Finds a `GhnOrder` entity by its `storeOrderId` and returns an `Optional` containing the entity.\\n\\n`existsByStoreOrderId(UUID storeOrderId)`: Checks if a `GhnOrder` entity with the given `storeOrderId` exists in the database.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/dto/request/GhnFeeRequest.java\":\"This file contains a single class `GhnFeeRequest` and a nested class `FeeItem`. The file does not contain any functions.\\n\\n`GhnFeeRequest`: This class represents a request for calculating the shipping fee from GHN (Giao Hng Nhanh), a Vietnamese logistics company, and includes various properties such as service type, sender and recipient locations, package dimensions, and weight.\\n\\n`FeeItem`: This nested class represents information about a single item in the package, including its name, quantity, dimensions, and weight.\\n\\nThe purpose of this file is to define the structure of a request for calculating the shipping fee from GHN, which can be used in an e-commerce application.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/dto/response/CampaignProductOverviewResponse.java\":\"This file defines a set of data transfer objects (DTOs) for an audio e-commerce application. It includes the following classes and functions:\\n\\n`CampaignProductOverviewResponse`: A DTO that represents the overview of a campaign, including the campaign details, the products involved, and associated vouchers and flash sale slots.\\n\\n`CampaignProductOverviewResponse.ProductDto`: A nested DTO that represents the details of a product within a campaign, including the product information, store information, and associated vouchers and flash sale slots.\\n\\n`CampaignProductOverviewResponse.VoucherDto`: A nested DTO that represents the details of a voucher associated with a product, including the type, discount value, and validity period.\\n\\n`CampaignProductOverviewResponse.FlashSlotDto`: A nested DTO that represents the details of a flash sale slot associated with a product, including the slot ID, open and close times, status, and associated voucher.\\n\\nThis file provides a structured way to represent and transfer the necessary data for the audio e-commerce application\\u0027s campaign and product management features.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/entity/Enum/RoleEnum.java\":\"This file defines an enumeration called `RoleEnum` that represents different roles or user types in an audio e-commerce application.\\n\\n`RoleEnum`: An enumeration that defines the different roles or user types in the audio e-commerce application, such as ADMIN, GUEST, STAFF, CUSTOMER, STOREOWNER, and FLATSTAFF.\\n\\n`getValue()`: A method that returns the integer value associated with each role in the `RoleEnum` enumeration.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/service/Impl/GhnFeeRequestBuilder.java\":\"This file contains a utility class `GhnFeeRequestBuilder` that provides a method to build a `GhnFeeRequest` object based on the items in a shopping cart.\\n\\n`GhnFeeRequestBuilder`: A utility class that builds a `GhnFeeRequest` object for GHN (Giao Hng Nhanh) shipping service.\\n\\n`buildForStoreShipment`: Builds a `GhnFeeRequest` object based on the items in a shopping cart, including product dimensions, weight, and quantity.\\n\\n`feeItemOf`: Constructs a `GhnFeeRequest.FeeItem` object for a single product in the shopping cart.\\n\\n`parseIntSafe`: A helper function that safely parses a string to an integer, returning `null` if the conversion fails.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/dto/request/SellBannerImageRequest.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `SellBannerImageRequest`, which is a data transfer object (DTO) used to represent a request for selling a banner image in an e-commerce application.\\n\\n`SellBannerImageRequest`: A DTO class that represents a request to sell a banner image, including the image URL, redirect URL, alt text, and sort order.\\n\\nThe file does not contain any functions, but rather defines the structure of the `SellBannerImageRequest` class using Lombok annotations to generate the necessary boilerplate code (getters, setters, constructors, and a builder).\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/entity/Enum/WalletStatus.java\":\"This file contains an enumeration (enum) named `WalletStatus`, which represents the different states a wallet can have in an audio e-commerce application.\\n\\n`WalletStatus`: An enumeration that defines the possible states of a wallet, including `ACTIVE`, `INACTIVE`, and `LOCKED`.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/service/Impl/WalletServiceImpl.java\":\"This file is an implementation of the `WalletService` interface, which provides functionality for managing customer wallets and their transactions.\\n\\n`WalletServiceImpl`: Implements the `WalletService` interface, providing methods for managing customer wallets and their transactions.\\n\\n`getByCustomer`: Retrieves the wallet for a given customer ID.\\n`deposit`: Performs a deposit transaction for a given customer ID and transaction request.\\n`withdraw`: Performs a withdrawal transaction for a given customer ID and transaction request.\\n`payment`: Performs a payment transaction for a given customer ID and transaction request, handling idempotency.\\n`refund`: Performs a refund transaction for a given customer ID and transaction request.\\n`listTransactions`: Retrieves a paginated list of wallet transactions for a given customer ID.\\n`doChangeBalance`: Handles the core logic for updating a wallet\\u0027s balance and creating a new wallet transaction.\\n`toWalletResponse`: Maps a `Wallet` entity to a `WalletResponse` DTO.\\n`toTxnResponse`: Maps a `WalletTransaction` entity to a `WalletTransactionResponse` DTO.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/dto/request/AddressCreateRequest.java\":\"This file contains a single class:\\n\\n`AddressCreateRequest`: A data transfer object (DTO) that represents a request to create a new address for an e-commerce application.\\n\\nThe file does not contain any functions. Instead, it defines the properties of the `AddressCreateRequest` class, which include the receiver\\u0027s name, phone number, address details (country, province, district, ward, street, and address line), postal code, note, a flag to indicate if the address is the default, and geographic coordinates (latitude and longitude).\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/repository/CustomerAddressRepository.java\":\"This file contains a single interface `CustomerAddressRepository` that extends the `JpaRepository` interface provided by Spring Data JPA.\\n\\n`CustomerAddressRepository`: An interface that provides CRUD operations and custom query methods for the `CustomerAddress` entity.\\n\\n`findByCustomerIdOrderByIsDefaultDescCreatedAtDesc(UUID customerId)`: Retrieves a list of `CustomerAddress` entities for the given `customerId`, ordered by the `isDefault` field in descending order and the `createdAt` field in descending order.\\n\\n`findByIdAndCustomerId(UUID id, UUID customerId)`: Retrieves an optional `CustomerAddress` entity with the given `id` and `customerId`.\\n\\n`countByCustomerId(UUID customerId)`: Counts the number of `CustomerAddress` entities for the given `customerId`.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/entity/Enum/StoreWalletTransactionType.java\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. It defines an enumeration called `StoreWalletTransactionType` that represents different types of transactions related to a store\\u0027s wallet, such as deposits, pending holds, release of pending funds, withdrawals, refunds, and manual adjustments.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/dto/request/StoreVoucherUse.java\":\"This file contains a single class:\\n\\n`StoreVoucherUse`: A data transfer object (DTO) that represents a request to use one or more voucher codes at a specific store.\\n\\nThis file does not contain any functions. It is a simple DTO class that holds the necessary information for a request to use voucher codes at a store.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/repository/PlatformFeeRepository.java\":\"This file contains a repository interface for the `PlatformFee` entity, which is used to manage platform fees in an e-commerce application.\\n\\n`PlatformFeeRepository`: This interface extends the `JpaRepository` interface and provides methods to interact with the `PlatformFee` entity in the database.\\n\\n`findByIsActiveTrue()`: This method returns an `Optional` of the `PlatformFee` entity that is currently active (i.e., `isActive` is `true`).\\n\\n`findFirstByIsActiveTrueOrderByEffectiveDateDesc()`: This method returns an `Optional` of the `PlatformFee` entity that is currently active, ordered by the effective date in descending order (i.e., the most recent active fee).\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/util/GeminiClient.java\":\"This file contains a single class `GeminiClient` that interacts with the Gemini API to generate content and SQL queries based on user input and a global schema.\\n\\n`GeminiClient`: A class that manages user conversations and global schema for a Gemini-based audio e-commerce application.\\n\\n`initSchemaGlobal(String schema)`: Initializes the global schema for the application by sending the schema to the Gemini API.\\n\\n`chat(String userId, String message)`: Handles user chat messages, limiting the conversation to audio-related topics and maintaining a per-user conversation history.\\n\\n`generateSql(String prompt)`: Generates a SQL query based on a given prompt, using the global schema stored in the class.\\n\\n`cleanupInactiveSessions()`: Periodically removes inactive user sessions from the conversation history.\\n\\n`hasGlobalSchema()`: Checks if a global schema has been initialized.\\n\\n`clearUserMemory(String userId)`: Clears the conversation history for a specific user.\\n\\n`clearAllSessions()`: Clears the conversation history for all users.\\n\\n`clearAllData()`: Clears the global schema and all user conversation history.\",\"/src/main/resources/templates/email/welcome_admin.html\":\"This file appears to be an HTML template for an email or web page that welcomes an admin user to a website. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather displays a greeting, a link to the admin console, and a closing message.\\n\\nThe file performs the following tasks:\\n\\n1. Displays a greeting to the admin user, using a variable `${name}` to insert the user\\u0027s name.\\n2. Informs the user that their admin account has been created.\\n3. Provides a link to the admin console, using the variable `${siteUrl}` to construct the URL.\\n4. Includes a closing message from the \\\"AudioEcommerce\\\" team.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/entity/Enum/ProductStatus.java\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. It defines an enumeration called `ProductStatus` that represents the different statuses a product can have in an e-commerce system. The enumeration includes the following values:\\n\\n`DRAFT`: Product is in draft status, not yet published.\\n`ACTIVE`: Product is active and available for sale.\\n`INACTIVE`: Product is temporarily unavailable for sale.\\n`OUT_OF_STOCK`: Product is out of stock but still displayed.\\n`DISCONTINUED`: Product is permanently discontinued and no longer available for sale.\\n`UNLISTED`: Product is temporarily hidden from the listing.\\n`SUSPENDED`: Product is temporarily suspended due to a violation.\\n`DELETED`: Product has been permanently deleted from the system.\\n`BANNED`: Product has been permanently banned from the system.\\n\\nThis enumeration provides a standardized way to represent the different states a product can have in the e-commerce application.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/service/Impl/DomainProvisioningService.java\":\"This file contains a service class `DomainProvisioningService` that handles the creation of customer and store entities in an audio e-commerce application.\\n\\n`DomainProvisioningService`: A service class that ensures the creation of customer and wallet entities, and optionally creates a default store for store owners.\\n\\n`ensureCustomerAndWallet`: A transactional method that creates a customer and a default wallet if they do not already exist for a given account.\\n\\n`ensureDefaultStore`: An optional transactional method that creates a default store for a store owner account if it does not already exist.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/dto/request/UpdateQtyRequest.java\":\"This file contains a single class:\\n\\n`UpdateQtyRequest`: A data transfer object (DTO) that represents a request to update the quantity of an item.\\n\\nThis file does not contain any functions. It simply defines a DTO class with a single property, `quantity`, which represents the new quantity to be updated.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/dto/response/AccountResponse.java\":\"This file contains a single class:\\n\\n`AccountResponse`: A data transfer object (DTO) that represents the response for an account, containing the user\\u0027s email, full name, and role.\\n\\nThis file does not contain any functions. It is a simple DTO class used to encapsulate and transfer account-related data between different layers of the application.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/entity/Enum/WalletOwnerType.java\":\"This file defines an enumeration called `WalletOwnerType` which represents the different types of wallets in an audio e-commerce system. The enumeration has three values:\\n\\n`WalletOwnerType`: Defines the different types of wallets in the audio e-commerce system, including the platform\\u0027s wallet, the shop\\u0027s wallet, and the customer\\u0027s wallet.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/service/Impl/WarrantyServiceImpl.java\":\"This file contains a service implementation class `WarrantyServiceImpl` that handles the logic for managing warranties for an e-commerce audio application.\\n\\n`WarrantyServiceImpl`: Implements the `WarrantyService` interface and provides methods for activating warranties, searching for warranties, opening and updating warranty tickets, setting serial numbers, and reviewing warranties.\\n\\n`activateForStoreOrder`: Activates warranties for all products in a given store order, creating new warranties as needed.\\n\\n`activateSingleItem`: Activates a warranty for a single store order item.\\n\\n`search`: Searches for warranties based on various criteria such as serial number, order ID, or customer phone/email.\\n\\n`openTicket`: Opens a new warranty ticket and logs the problem description, coverage status, and any attachments.\\n\\n`updateTicketStatus`: Updates the status of an existing warranty ticket and allows adding additional details such as diagnosis, resolution, and costs.\\n\\n`setSerialFirstTime`: Sets the serial number for a warranty, if it has not been set before.\\n\\n`review`: Allows a customer to review a warranty and provide a rating and comment.\\n\\n`toWarrantyResponse`, `toLogResponse`, and `toReviewResponse`: Helper methods to convert entity objects to their corresponding response DTOs.\\n\\n`evaluateCoverage`: Evaluates whether a warranty is still valid based on the start date and duration.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/config/RestTemplateConfig.java\":\"This file does not contain any classes, but it does contain one function:\\n\\n`restTemplate()`: This function creates a new `RestTemplate` object, which is a Spring class used for making HTTP requests to external services.\\n\\nThe purpose of this file is to configure a `RestTemplate` bean in the Spring application context, which can then be used by other components in the application to make HTTP requests.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/service/AiQueryService.java\":\"This file defines an interface called `AiQueryService` that provides methods for interacting with an AI-powered query system. The interface has the following methods:\\n\\n`initSchema()`: Initializes the schema for the AI system (to be called only once).\\n\\n`handleUserQuery(AiQueryRequest request)`: Processes a user\\u0027s query and generates an `AiQueryResponse` object.\\n\\n`chatWithGemini(AiQueryRequest request)`: Allows the user to chat freely with the AI system, with session management based on the user\\u0027s ID.\\n\\nThe file does not contain any class definitions, but rather defines an interface that can be implemented by a service class to provide AI-powered query handling and chat functionality.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/controller/StoreWalletController.java\":\"This file contains a Spring Boot REST controller class for managing a store\\u0027s wallet transactions.\\n\\n`StoreWalletController`: A REST controller class that provides APIs for managing a store\\u0027s wallet, including retrieving the current wallet information, listing wallet transactions, and filtering transactions based on various criteria.\\n\\n`getMyWallet()`: Retrieves the current wallet information for the authenticated store.\\n\\n`getMyWalletTransactions()`: Retrieves a paginated list of wallet transactions for the authenticated store, with optional filtering by transaction type.\\n\\n`filterTransactions()`: Filters the list of wallet transactions for the authenticated store or a specific wallet, based on various criteria such as time range, transaction type, and transaction ID.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/email/EmailTemplate.java\":\"This file defines a single class, `EmailTemplate`, which is used to represent an email message with a recipient, subject, and HTML content.\\n\\n`EmailTemplate`: A class that represents an email message with a recipient, subject, and HTML content.\\n\\nThe file does not contain any functions, only the definition of the `EmailTemplate` class.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/service/DeliveryService.java\":\"This file defines the `DeliveryService` interface, which provides methods for managing the delivery process of store orders in an e-commerce application.\\n\\n`DeliveryService`: Defines the interface for managing the delivery process of store orders.\\n\\n`assignDeliveryStaff`: Assigns a delivery staff member and a prepared-by staff member to a store order.\\n`markReadyForPickup`: Marks a store order as ready for pickup.\\n`markOutForDelivery`: Marks a store order as out for delivery.\\n`markDeliveredWaitingConfirm`: Marks a store order as delivered and waiting for confirmation.\\n`confirmDeliverySuccess`: Confirms the successful delivery of a store order.\\n`markDeliveryDenied`: Marks a store order as delivery denied.\\n`pushLocation`: Pushes the location of a delivery staff member to the system.\\n`listAssignments`: Lists the delivery assignments for a store based on the order status.\\n`pageAssignments`: Retrieves a paginated list of delivery assignments for a store based on the order status.\\n`getAssignment`: Retrieves a specific delivery assignment for a store.\\n`getStoreOrderEntity`: Retrieves the store order entity for a given store order ID.\\n`listAssignmentsOfStaff`: Lists the delivery assignments for a specific staff member based on the order status.\\n`pageAssignmentsOfStaff`: Retrieves a paginated list of delivery assignments for a specific staff member based on the order status.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/entity/StoreOrderItem.java\":\"This file defines the `StoreOrderItem` entity, which represents an item in a store order. The file does not contain any classes or functions, but rather defines the properties and relationships of the `StoreOrderItem` entity.\\n\\n`StoreOrderItem`: An entity that represents an item in a store order, including its type, reference ID, name, quantity, unit price, and line total.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/service/Impl/ProductViewServiceImpl.java\":\"This file contains a single class `ProductViewServiceImpl` that implements the `ProductViewService` interface. The class provides two main functions:\\n\\n`getThumbnailView`: This function retrieves a paginated list of products with various filtering options, and returns a response containing the product data, including information about the product, store, and any applicable vouchers.\\n\\n`getActiveVouchersOfProduct`: This function retrieves the active vouchers (both shop and platform vouchers) associated with a specific product, and returns a response containing the product data and the voucher information.\\n\\nThe file also includes a helper function `buildVariantList` that constructs a list of variant information for a given product.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/dto/response/ProductResponse.java\":\"This file contains a single class `ProductResponse` which is a data transfer object (DTO) for representing a product in an e-commerce application. The class has various properties that describe the product, such as its identifier, name, description, price, variants, images, and other relevant details. The class also includes several nested classes, such as `VariantResponse` and `BulkDiscountResponse`, which provide additional information about the product\\u0027s variants and bulk discounts, respectively.\\n\\nThe file does not contain any functions, as it is primarily a data structure for organizing and transferring product-related information.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/repository/WarrantyReviewRepository.java\":\"This file contains a single interface:\\n\\n`WarrantyReviewRepository`: This interface extends the `JpaRepository` interface and is responsible for providing CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations for the `WarrantyReview` entity, which is identified by a UUID (Universally Unique Identifier) primary key.\\n\\nThe file does not contain any classes or functions. It defines a repository interface that allows for the management of `WarrantyReview` entities in a database using the Spring Data JPA framework.\",\"/src/main/resources/templates/email/kyc_rejected.html\":\"This file appears to be an HTML template for an email notification regarding a rejected KYC (Know Your Customer) application. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather displays information about the rejected application, including the store name, the reason for rejection, and a link to the KYC page for the user to update and resubmit the application.\\n\\nThe file does the following:\\n1. Displays a greeting to the user with their name.\\n2. Informs the user that the KYC application for their store has been rejected.\\n3. Provides the reason for the rejection.\\n4. Includes a link for the user to update and resubmit the KYC application.\\n5. Closes with a signature from the AudioEcommerce team.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/dto/response/StaffResponse.java\":\"This file contains a single class:\\n\\n`StaffResponse`: A data transfer object (DTO) that represents a staff member\\u0027s information, including their ID, username, full name, email, phone, and store ID.\\n\\nThis file does not contain any functions. It is a simple DTO class used to transfer staff member data between different parts of the application.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/email/EmailTemplateType.java\":\"This file defines an `enum` called `EmailTemplateType` which represents different types of email templates used in an audio e-commerce application. The `enum` includes the following values:\\n\\n`EmailTemplateType`: Defines the different types of email templates used in the application, such as account welcome, account creation, KYC submission, KYC approval, KYC rejection, order confirmation, and password reset.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/repository/CartItemRepository.java\":\"This file contains a single interface:\\n\\n`CartItemRepository`: This interface extends the `JpaRepository` interface and is responsible for providing CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations for the `CartItem` entity, which is identified by a `UUID` primary key.\\n\\nThe file does not contain any classes or functions. framework.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/util/WeightUtils.java\":\"This file contains a utility class `WeightUtils` with a single static function `kgToGram()` that converts a `BigDecimal` value representing kilograms to an integer value representing grams, rounding up to the nearest integer.\\n\\n`WeightUtils`: A utility class for weight-related operations.\\n\\n`kgToGram(BigDecimal kg)`: Converts a weight in kilograms to the equivalent weight in grams, rounding up to the nearest integer.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/entity/DeliveryProof.java\":\"This file defines a JPA entity class `DeliveryProof` that represents a delivery proof record in an e-commerce notes.\\n\\nThe file does not contain any functions, but rather defines the properties and relationships of the `DeliveryProof` entity class, which is used to persist delivery proof data in a staff.\\n\\n`getStoreById`: Retrieves the details of a store by its ID.\\n`getStoreByAccount`: Retrieves the store associated with a given account ID.\\n`updateStore`: Updates the information of a store.\\n`updateStoreStatus`: Updates the status of a store.\\n`getAllStores`: Retrieves a paginated list of all stores, with optional search by keyword.\\n`getMyStoreId`: Retrieves the ID of the store associated with the currently authenticated user.\\n`createStaff`: Creates a new staff member for a given store.\\n`getAllAddresses`: Retrieves the list of addresses associated with the store of currently authenticated user.\\n`deleteStoreAddress`: Deletes an address from the store of the currently authenticated user.\\n`setDefaultAddress`: Sets a given address as the default address for the store of the currently authenticated user.\\n`getAllStaff`: Retrieves a paginated list of all staff members for a given store.\\n`getStaffById`: Retrieves the details of a staff member by their ID and without authentication.\\n\\n`privateApi(Authentication authentication)`: A private API endpoint that requires a valid authentication token to access.\\n\\n`testRole(@AuthenticationPrincipal authorities.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/service/Impl/ProductServiceImpl.java\":\"This file contains a single class `ProductServiceImpl` that implements the `ProductService` `ProductComboService` interface to manage product combos.\\n\\n`getLoginEmail()`: Retrieves the email of the currently logged-in user.\\n\\n`validateProductsInSameStore(List\\u003cProduct\\u003e products, UUID storeId)`: Validates that all the products in the list belong to the same store.\\n\\n`validateActive(List\\u003cProduct\\u003e products)`: Validates that all the products in the list are in the \\\"ACTIVE\\\" status.\\n\\n`buildQtyMap(List\\u003cComboItemRequest\\u003e items)`: Builds a map of product IDs and their quantities based on the provided combo size, String keyword, Boolean isActive)`: Retrieves a paginated list of product combos created by the current customer.\\n\\n`createShopCombo(CreateShopComboRequest req)`: Creates a new product combo for the current shop.\\n\\n`updateShopCombo(UUID comboId, UpdateShopComboRequest req)`: Updates an existing product combo for the current shop.\\n\\n`createCustomerCombo(CreateCustomerComboRequest req)`: Creates a new product combo for the current customer.\\n\\n`updateCustomerCombo(UUID comboId, UpdateCustomerComboRequest req)`: Updates an existing product combo for the current customer.\\n\\n`applyCommonUpdate(ProductCombo combo, UpdateShopComboRequest req)`: Applies common updates to a product combo.\\n\\n`applyCommonUpdate(ProductCombo combo, UpdateCustomerComboRequest req)`: Applies common updates to a product combo.\\n\\n`toResponse(ProductCombo c)`: Converts a `ProductCombo` entity to a `ProductComboResponse` object.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/entity/Category.java\":\"This file defines a `Category` entity class for an audio e-commerce application. Concludes with a closing message from the AudioEcommerce team.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/service/WalletService.java\":\"This file defines an interface called `WalletService` that provides methods for managing a customer\\u0027s wallet, including getting the wallet balance, depositing, withdrawing, making payments, and processing refunds, as well as listing the customer\\u0027s wallet transactions.\\n\\n`WalletService`: An interface that defines methods for managing a customer\\u0027s wallet.\\n\\n`getByCustomer(UUID customerId)`: Retrieves the wallet information for the specified customer.\\n\\n`deposit(UUID customerId, WalletTxnRequest req)`: Deposits funds into the customer\\u0027s wallet.\\n\\n`withdraw(UUID customerId, WalletTxnRequest req)`: Withdraws funds from the customer\\u0027s wallet.\\n\\n`payment(UUID customerId, WalletTxnRequest req)`: Processes a payment from the customer\\u0027s wallet.\\n\\n`refund(UUID customerId, WalletTxnRequest req)`: transactions.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/service/Impl/StaffServiceImpl.java\":\"This file contains a service implementation class for managing staff in an audio e-commerce saving a new `Account` and `Staff` entity in the database.\\n`getAllStaffByStoreId`: Retrieves a list of all staff members associated with a specific store.\\n`getStaffById`: Retrieves a specific DTO.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/service/Impl/OrderCancellationServiceImpl.java\":\"This file contains an implementation of the `OrderCancellationService` interface, which provides methods for handling the cancellation of customer orders and store orders in an e-commerce application.\\n\\n`OrderCancellationServiceImpl`: Implements the `OrderCancellationService` interface and provides methods for handling the cancellation of customer orders and store orders.\\n\\n`customerCancelWholeOrderIfPending`: Cancels a customer order that is in the \\\"PENDING\\\" status and refunds the entire order amount to the customer\\u0027s wallet.\\n\\n`shopApproveCancel`: Approves the cancellation of a store order, refunds the store\\u0027s portion of the order to the customer\\u0027s wallet, and cancels the customer order if all store orders are cancelled.\\n\\n`shopRejectCancel`: Rejects the cancellation of a store order and updates the cancellation request status.\\n\\n`customerRequestCancelStoreOrderByCustomerOrderId`: Allows a customer to request the cancellation of a store order that is in the \\\"AWAITING_SHIPMENT\\\" status.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/service/ProductService.java\":\"This file defines an interface called `ProductService` that provides methods for managing products in an (DTO) that represents a request to update a customer\\u0027s combo product, including details such as the product name, description, images, weight, stock quantity, shipping information, and a list of combo items.\\n\\nThis file does not contain any functions. The class also has two indexes defined to facilitate efficient querying of the data.\\n\\n`DeliveryLocationLog`: A JPA entity class that represents a log of a delivery location for a specific store order and delivery assignment.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/dto/request/WarrantyActivateSerialRequest.java\":\"This file contains a single class:\\n\\n`WarrantyActivateSerialRequest`: A data transfer object (DTO) that represents a request to activate a warranty using a serial number and an optional note.\\n\\nThis file does not contain any functions. It is a simple DTO class used to encapsulate the necessary information for a warranty activation request.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/service/ShopVoucherService.java\":\"This file defines an interface called `ShopVoucherService` that provides methods for managing shop vouchers in an e-commerce application.\\n\\n`ShopVoucherService`: An interface that defines methods for creating, retrieving, disabling, and getting active vouchers by product ID.\\n\\n`createVoucher`: Creates a new voucher.\\n`getAllVouchers`: Retrieves all available vouchers.\\n`getVoucherById`: Retrieves a voucher by its unique identifier.\\n`disableVoucher`: Disables a voucher.\\n`getActiveVoucherByProductId`: Retrieves the active voucher for a given product ID.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/dto/response/SellBannerResponse.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `SellBannerResponse`, which is a data transfer object (DTO) used to represent the response data for a sell banner in an e-commerce application.\\n\\n`SellBannerResponse`: A DTO class that represents the response data for a sell banner, including its ID, title, description, banner type, active status, start and end times, associated images, and creation and update timestamps.\\n\\nThis file does not contain any functions, as it is solely a DTO class used for data transfer purposes.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/security/oauth/OAuth2AuthenticationFailureHandler.java\":\"This file contains a single class and one function:\\n\\n`OAuth2AuthenticationFailureHandler`: This class is responsible for handling authentication failures in an OAuth2-based authentication system.\\n\\n`onAuthenticationFailure`: This function is called when an authentication failure occurs during the OAuth2 authentication process. It constructs a redirect URL with the error message and sends a 302 (redirect) response to the client.\\n\\nThe purpose of this file is to provide a custom implementation of the `AuthenticationFailureHandler` interface from the Spring Security framework, which is used to handle authentication failures in an OAuth2-based authentication system.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/entity/PlatformCampaign.java\":\"This file defines the `PlatformCampaign` entity, which represents a campaign or promotion on an e-commerce platform. The entity has various attributes such as a unique code, name, description, campaign type, display information, start and end times, status, and approval rules. It also has relationships with other entities such as participating stores, products, and flash sale slots.\\n\\n`PlatformCampaign`: An entity that represents a campaign or promotion on an e-commerce platform.\\n\\n`onCreate()`: A pre-persist function that sets the `createdAt` timestamp and the default `status` of the campaign to `ACTIVE`.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/repository/ShopVoucherProductRepository.java\":\"This file contains a Spring Data JPA repository interface named `ShopVoucherProductRepository` that provides methods for interacting with the `ShopVoucherProduct` entity in the database.\\n\\n`ShopVoucherProductRepository`: This interface extends the `JpaRepository` interface and provides methods for querying and manipulating `ShopVoucherProduct` entities.\\n\\n`existsByProduct_ProductIdAndVoucher_Status`: This method checks if a `ShopVoucherProduct` entity exists with the given `productId` and `VoucherStatus`.\\n\\n`findFirstByProduct_ProductIdAndVoucher_Status`: This method finds the first `ShopVoucherProduct` entity with the given `productId` and `VoucherStatus`.\\n\\n`findActiveVoucherByProduct`: This method finds the active `ShopVoucher` entity associated with the given `productId` and the current time.\\n\\n`findActiveShopVoucherProduct`: This method finds the active `ShopVoucherProduct` entity associated with the given `productId` and the current time.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/dto/response/ShippingMethodResponse.java\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions.
