The class contains various properties that describe the shipping method, such as the name, code, logo URL, base fee, fee per kilogram, estimated delivery days, support for cash-on-delivery and insurance, activity status, description, contact phone, and website URL.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/dto/response/PagedResult.java\":\"This file defines a data transfer object (DTO) for a paged result, which is commonly used in pagination scenarios. It contains the following:\\n\\n`PagedResult\\u003cT\\u003e`: A class that represents a paged result, containing a list of items, the total number of elements, the total number of pages, the current page, and the page size.\\n\\nThe file does not contain any functions, as it is a simple data class using Lombok annotations to generate the necessary boilerplate code (getters, setters, builder, and constructors).\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/service/PlatformWalletService.java\":\"This file does not contain any classes, but rather an interface named `PlatformWalletService` that defines the following functions:\\n\\n`getAllWallets()`: Retrieves a list of all platform wallets.\\n\\n`getWalletByOwner(UUID ownerId)`: Retrieves a platform wallet by its owner ID (either a shop or a customer).\\n\\n`filterTransactions(UUID storeId, UUID customerId, TransactionStatus status, TransactionType type, LocalDateTime from, LocalDateTime to)`: Filters platform transactions based on the provided parameters (store ID, customer ID, transaction status, transaction type, and date range).\\n\\nThis interface is likely part of a larger application that manages an e-commerce platform\\u0027s wallet and transaction functionality.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/controller/ProductController.java\":\"This file contains a Spring Boot controller class for managing products in an e-commerce application.\\n\\n`ProductController`: This class handles the CRUD operations for products, including fetching a list of products, retrieving details of a specific product, creating a new product, updating an existing product, and disabling a product.\\n\\n`getAllProducts`: This function retrieves a list of products based on various filtering and pagination parameters.\\n\\n`getProductById`: This function retrieves the details of a specific product by its ID.\\n\\n`createProduct`: This function creates a new product based on the provided request data.\\n\\n`updateProduct`: This function updates an existing product by its ID and the provided request data.\\n\\n`disableProduct`: This function disables an existing product by its ID, marking it as inactive.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/dto/request/ShopVoucherRequest.java\":\"This file defines a data transfer object (DTO) for a shop voucher request in an audio e-commerce application.\\n\\n`ShopVoucherRequest`: A class that represents a request for a shop voucher, containing information about the voucher, its discount, usage limits, and the list of products it applies to.\\n\\n`VoucherProductItem`: A nested class within `ShopVoucherRequest` that represents a product item associated with a voucher, including its discount information and purchase limits.\\n\\nThe file does not contain any functions, but rather defines the structure of the `ShopVoucherRequest` DTO, which can be used to transfer data between the application\\u0027s layers.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/entity/Enum/OrderStatus.java\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. It defines an `OrderStatus` enum, which represents the different statuses that an order can have in an e-commerce application. The enum includes statuses such as `UNPAID`, `CONFIRMED`, `AWAITING_SHIPMENT`, `SHIPPING`, `COMPLETED`, `CANCELLED`, `RETURN_REQUESTED`, `RETURNED`, `PENDING`, `READY_FOR_PICKUP`, `OUT_FOR_DELIVERY`, `DELIVERED_WAITING_CONFIRM`, `DELIVERY_SUCCESS`, `DELIVERY_DENIED`, and `READY_FOR_DELIVERY`. These statuses cover the various stages of the order lifecycle, from the initial order placement to the final delivery and potential returns.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/dto/response/WarrantyReviewResponse.java\":\"This file contains a single class:\\n\\n`WarrantyReviewResponse`: A data transfer object (DTO) that represents a customer\\u0027s review of a warranty service.\\n\\nThis file does not contain any functions. The purpose of this file is to define the structure of the `WarrantyReviewResponse` DTO, which includes fields such as the review ID, warranty ID, customer ID, customer name, rating, comment, and the time the review was created.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/email/AccountData.java\":\"This file contains a single class:\\n\\n`AccountData`: A data class that holds information about a user\\u0027s account, including their email, name, role, and the URL of the site they are associated with.\\n\\nThis file does not contain any functions. It is a simple data class used to represent account information.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/controller/ProductViewController.java\":\"This file contains a Spring Boot REST controller class for handling product-related operations in an e-commerce application.\\n\\n`ProductViewController`: This class is responsible for handling product-related API endpoints, including retrieving product thumbnails with various filters and retrieving active vouchers for a specific product.\\n\\n`getProductThumbnails`: This function retrieves a paginated list of product thumbnails based on various filter parameters, such as status, category, store, keyword, location, and price range.\\n\\n`getProductVouchers`: This function retrieves the active vouchers for a specific product, with optional filtering by voucher type and campaign type.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/service/Impl/CustomerServiceImpl.java\":\"This file is an implementation of the `CustomerService` interface, which provides functionality for managing customer-related operations in an e-commerce application.\\n\\n`CustomerServiceImpl`: Implements the `CustomerService` interface and provides methods for creating, retrieving, updating, and deleting customers, as well as managing their addresses.\\n\\n`create`: Creates a new customer with the provided information and saves it to the database.\\n`get`: Retrieves a customer by their unique identifier.\\n`search`: Searches for customers based on a keyword and customer status, and returns a paginated result.\\n`update`: Updates an existing customer with the provided information.\\n`softDelete`: Soft-deletes a customer by setting their status to `DELETED`.\\n`listAddresses`: Retrieves a list of addresses associated with a customer.\\n`addAddress`: Adds a new address for a customer.\\n`updateAddress`: Updates an existing address for a customer.\\n`deleteAddress`: Deletes an address for a customer.\\n`setDefaultAddress`: Sets a default address for a customer.\\n`ensureCustomerExists`: Ensures that a customer with the given identifier exists.\\n`setDefaultInternal`: Sets the default address for a customer internally.\\n`toCustomerResponse`: Converts a `Customer` entity to a `CustomerResponse` DTO.\\n`toAddressResponse`: Converts a `CustomerAddress` entity to an `AddressResponse` DTO.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/entity/Wallet.java\":\"This file defines a `Wallet` entity class for an audio e-commerce application, which represents a customer\\u0027s wallet with a balance, currency, status, and the time of the last transaction.\\n\\n`Wallet`: A class that represents a customer\\u0027s wallet, which includes a balance, currency, status, and the time of the last transaction.\\n\\nThe file does not contain any functions, but it uses the Lombok library to generate the necessary getters, setters, constructors, and a builder for the `Wallet` class.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/service/Impl/CustomerOrderServiceImpl.java\":\"This file contains a single class and several functions:\\n\\n`CustomerOrderServiceImpl`: This class is an implementation of the `CustomerOrderService` interface, providing functionality for managing customer orders.\\n\\n`getCustomerOrders`: This function retrieves a paged list of customer orders for a given customer ID, including details about the associated store orders and order items.\\n\\n`toCustomerOrderDetail`: This function maps a `CustomerOrder` entity to a `CustomerOrderDetailResponse` object, which includes the order details and associated store orders.\\n\\n`toStoreOrderSummary`: This function maps a `StoreOrder` entity to a `CustomerOrderDetailResponse.StoreOrderSummary` object, which includes the store order details and associated order items.\\n\\n`toItemResponses`: This function maps a list of `StoreOrderItem` entities to a list of `StoreOrderItemResponse` objects, which include the details of each order item.\\n\\n`defaultBigDecimal`: This is a helper function that returns a `BigDecimal` value, defaulting to `BigDecimal.ZERO` if the input value is `null`.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/dto/request/CustomerCreateRequest.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `CustomerCreateRequest`, which is a data transfer object (DTO) used for creating a customer in an audio e-commerce application.\\n\\n`CustomerCreateRequest`: A DTO class that represents the necessary information for creating a new customer, including their full name, username, email, phone number, password, gender, date of birth, avatar URL, two-factor authentication status, and preferred category.\\n\\nThe file does not contain any functions, but rather defines the structure and validation rules for the `CustomerCreateRequest` DTO using Lombok annotations and Jakarta validation constraints.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/config/PayosConfig.java\":\"This file is a Spring configuration class that sets up a `PayOS` bean using values from the application\\u0027s eligibility for COD payment, including a list of individual stores and their eligibility status.\\n\\n`PerStore`: A nested class within `CodEligibilityResponse` that represents the eligibility status of a single store, including the store\\u0027s ID, name, subtotal, required deposit, deposit balance, and the reason for ineligibility (if any).\\n\\nThe file does not contain any functions, as it is a data transfer object class.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/repository/CustomerOrderItemRepository.java\":\"This file contains a single interface:\\n\\n`CustomerOrderItemRepository`: (Universally Unique Identifier) primary key.\\n\\nThe file does not contain any classes or functions. It defines a repository interface that allows for the management of `CustomerOrderItem` entities in a database using the Spring Data JPA framework.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/entity/CartItem.java\":\"This file defines the `CartItem` entity class, which represents an item in a shopping cart. The class has several properties that represent the various information required for creating an order, such as payment details, sender information, recipient information, order details, and product information.\\n\\n`GhnCreateOrderRequest`: A DTO class that represents the request data for creating an order with the GHN shipping service.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/entity/Customer.java\":\"This file defines the `Customer` entity class, which represents a customer in an e-commerce application. The class has several properties and methods related to customer information, status, security, KYC (Know Your Customer), addresses, loyalty, vouchers, order counters, and account management.\\n\\n`Customer`: Represents a customer in the e-commerce application, with various attributes and methods to manage customer-related data.\\n\\n`addAddress`: Adds a new address to the customer\\u0027s list of addresses and sets the default address if necessary.\\n\\n`setDefaultAddress`: Sets the default address for the customer and updates the `isDefault` flag for all addresses.\\n\\n`removeAddress`: Removes an address from the customer\\u0027s list of addresses and updates the default address if necessary.\\n\\n`increaseOrderCounters`: Increments the order count, unpaid order count, and updates the last order date for the customer.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/service/Impl/PayOSEcomServiceImpl.java\":\"This file is an implementation of the `PayOSEcomService` interface, which is responsible for handling payment-related operations in an e-commerce application.\\n\\n`PayOSEcomServiceImpl`: This class implements the `PayOSEcomService` interface and provides functionality for creating payment links, processing payment webhooks, and sending payment confirmation emails.\\n\\n`generateOrderCode()`: This function generates a unique order code for a customer order.\\n\\n`createPaymentForMultipleCustomerOrders()`: This function creates a payment link for a group of customer orders, updates the order status, and returns a `CheckoutOnlineResponse` object.\\n\\n`confirmWebhook()`: This function processes a payment webhook from the PayOS payment gateway, updates the order status, and records the payment transaction.\\n\\n`sendPaymentSuccessEmail()`: This function sends a payment confirmation email to the customer after a successful payment.\\n\\n`asciiNoMarks()`: This function removes non-ASCII characters and diacritical marks from a string.\\n\\n`cutUtf8Bytes()`: This function truncates a string to a maximum number of UTF-8 bytes.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/repository/ShippingMethodRepository.java\":\"This file contains a single interface `ShippingMethodRepository` that extends the `JpaRepository` interface from Spring Data JPA.\\n\\n`ShippingMethodRepository`: This interface provides methods for interacting with the `ShippingMethod` entity in the database, including the ability to check if a shipping method with a given name already exists.\\n\\n`existsByName(String name)`: This method checks if a shipping method with the given name already exists in the database.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/service/Impl/CartServiceImpl.java\":\"This file contains the implementation of the `CartService` interface, which is responsible for managing the shopping cart functionality in an e-commerce application.\\n\\n`CartServiceImpl`: Implements the `CartService` interface and provides methods for adding, updating, and removing items from the shopping cart, as well as checking out the cart and creating customer orders.\\n\\n`addItems`: Adds items to the customer\\u0027s active shopping cart, handling both products and product combos.\\n`getActiveCart`: Retrieves the customer\\u0027s active shopping cart.\\n`checkCodEligibility`: Checks the customer\\u0027s eligibility for cash-on-delivery (COD) payment based on the store\\u0027s deposit balance.\\n`checkoutCODWithResponse`: Processes a COD checkout, creating customer orders split by store and applying any applicable vouchers.\\n`createOrderForOnline`: Processes an online checkout, creating customer orders split by store and applying any applicable vouchers.\\n`updateItemQuantity`: Updates the quantity of an item in the customer\\u0027s active shopping cart.\\n`removeItems`: Removes items from the customer\\u0027s active shopping cart.\\n`clearCart`: Clears all items from the customer\\u0027s active shopping cart.\\n`bulkUpdateQuantities`: Bulk updates the quantities of items in the customer\\u0027s active shopping cart.\\n`checkoutStoreShip`: Processes a store-ship checkout, creating customer orders split by store without any shipping fees.\\n`toOrderResponse`: Converts a `CustomerOrder` entity to a `CustomerOrderResponse` DTO.\\n`createOrdersSplitByStore_StoreShipNoFee`: Handles the creation of customer orders split by store for a store-ship checkout, without any shipping fees.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/email/dto/KycApprovedData.java\":\"This file contains a single data class `KycApprovedData` that name, store name, and site URL.\\n\\nThis file does not contain any functions. It is a simple data transfer object (DTO) used to encapsulate and transfer data related to a user\\u0027s KYC approval in an email context.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/entity/Enum/GhnStatus.java\":\"This file defines an enumeration called `GhnStatus` that represents the different statuses of a delivery order. different product types (headphones, speakers, amplifiers, microphones, turntables, and audio interfaces).\\n\\nThe file does not contain any functions, but rather focuses on defining the structure and documentation of the `UpdateProductRequest` class using Lombok annotations and Swagger annotations for API documentation.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/dto/response/CustomerOrderDetailResponse.java\":\"This file contains a data transfer object (DTO) for a customer order detail response in and a list of store orders.\\n\\n`StoreOrderSummary`: A nested DTO that represents the summary information of a store order within the customer\\u0027s order, including the store ID, store name, order status, and a list of order items.\\n\\nThe file does not contain any functions, but rather defines the structure and properties of the DTOs used to represent the customer order details and store order summaries in the application.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/controller/StoreKycController.java\":\"This file contains a Spring Boot REST controller class for managing the KYC (Know Your Customer) process for stores in an e-commerce application.\\n\\n`StoreKycController`: This class handles the CRUD operations related to the KYC process for stores, including submitting KYC requests, retrieving KYC request details, filtering KYC requests by status, and approving or rejecting KYC requests.\\n\\n`submitKyc`: Allows a store owner to submit a KYC request with the necessary information.\\n`getAllRequests`: Retrieves a list of all KYC requests for a specific store.\\n`getRequestDetail`: Retrieves the details of a specific KYC request.\\n`getAllKycByStatus`: Retrieves a list of KYC requests filtered by their status (PENDING, APPROVED, REJECTED).\\n`approve`: Allows an admin to approve a KYC request and activate the store.\\n`reject`: Allows an admin to reject a KYC request with a specific reason.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/entity/LogWarranty.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `LogWarranty`, which represents a warranty log entry in an description, diagnosis, resolution, and the associated costs.\\n\\n`onOpen()`: This method is called when a new `LogWarranty` instance is created, and it sets the `openedAt` and `updatedAt` fields, and the `status` field if it is not already set.\\n\\n`onUpdate()`: This method is called when a `LogWarranty` instance is updated, and it updates the `updatedAt` field, sets the `closedAt` field if the status is `COMPLETED`, and calculates the `costTotal` field based on the `costLabor` and `costParts` fields.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/dto/request/UpdateCampaignRequest.java\":\"This file defines a data transfer object (DTO) for updating a campaign in an audio e-commerce It is a data class that is used to transfer order-related data between different components of the application.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/service/Impl/StoreWalletServiceImpl.java\":\"This file is a Java class named `StoreWalletServiceImpl` that implements the `StoreWalletService` interface. It provides the following functionality:\\n\\n`StoreWalletServiceImpl`: This class is responsible for managing the store wallet, including retrieving the wallet information, getting the list of wallet transactions, and filtering transactions based on various criteria.\\n\\n`getMyWallet()`: This function retrieves the summary information of the store\\u0027s wallet, including the available balance, pending balance, deposit balance, and total revenue.\\n\\n`getMyWalletTransactions(int page, int size, String type)`: This function retrieves the list of wallet transactions for the current store, with pagination and optional filtering by transaction type.\\n\\n`filterTransactions(UUID walletId, LocalDateTime from, LocalDateTime to, StoreWalletTransactionType type, UUID transactionId, Pageable pageable)`: This function filters the wallet transactions based on various criteria, such as wallet ID, time range, transaction type, and transaction ID.\\n\\n`getCurrentStoreWalletId()`: This is a utility function that retrieves the wallet ID of the current store.\\n\\n`mapToTransactionResponse(StoreWalletTransaction tx)`: This function maps a `StoreWalletTransaction` entity to a `StoreWalletTransactionResponse` DTO.\\n\\n`getDisplayName(StoreWalletTransactionType type)`: This is a helper function that returns a user-friendly display name for a given `StoreWalletTransactionType`.\\n\\n`resolveWalletIdForCurrentUser()`: This function retrieves the wallet ID of the current store.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/controller/PlatformFeeController.java\":\"This file contains a Spring Boot REST controller class for managing platform fees in an audio e-commerce application.\\n\\n`PlatformFeeController`: A REST controller class that provides CRUD operations for managing platform fees.\\n\\n`create`: Creates a new platform fee.\\n`update`: Updates an existing platform fee.\\n`getActive`: Retrieves the currently active platform fee.\\n`getAll`: Retrieves a list of all platform fees.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/service/Impl/PlatformFeeServiceImpl.java\":\"This file contains a service implementation for managing platform fees in an audio e-commerce application.\\n\\n`PlatformFeeServiceImpl`: Implements the `PlatformFeeService` interface to handle CRUD operations for platform fees.\\n\\n`create(PlatformFee fee)`: Creates a new platform fee, deactivating any existing active fee.\\n`update(UUID id, PlatformFee fee)`: Updates an existing platform fee by its ID.\\n`getActiveFee()`: Retrieves the currently active platform fee.\\n`getAll()`: Retrieves a list of all platform fees.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/dto/request/GhnCategory.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `GhnCategory`, which is a data transfer object (DTO) used for representing a category in an e-commerce application.\\n\\n`GhnCategory`: A class that represents a category in an e-commerce application, with three levels of categorization (level1, level2, and level3).\\n\\nThis file does not contain any functions, as it is solely focused on defining the structure of the `GhnCategory` class using Lombok annotations for generating boilerplate code.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/service/Impl/GhnFeeServiceImpl.java\":\"`GhnFeeServiceImpl`: This class is an implementation of the `GhnFeeService` interface, which provides a service for calculating shipping fees using the GHN (Giao Hng Nhanh) API.\\n\\n`headers()`: This function creates an `HttpHeaders` object with the necessary headers for making requests to the GHN API, including the GHN token and shop ID.\\n\\n`calculateFeeRaw(GhnFeeRequest req)`: This function takes a `GhnFeeRequest` object, sends it to the GHN API using the `restTemplate`, and returns the raw response body as a `String`.\\n\\nOverall, this file provides an implementation of a service for calculating shipping fees using the GHN API, with the necessary configuration and request handling logic.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/security/oauth/CustomOAuth2UserService.java\":\"This file contains a single class and one function:\\n\\n`CustomOAuth2UserService`: A custom implementation of the `DefaultOAuth2UserService` that can be used to handle the authentication and authorization of users in an OAuth2-based application.\\n\\n`loadUser`: Overrides the `loadUser` method of the `DefaultOAuth2UserService` to allow for additional processing or logging of the user information retrieved during the OAuth2 authentication process.\\n\\nThe purpose of this file is to provide a custom implementation of the `OAuth2UserService` that can be used to handle the authentication and authorization of users in an OAuth2-based application. The `CustomOAuth2UserService` class extends the `DefaultOAuth2UserService` and overrides the `loadUser` method to allow for additional processing or logging of the user information retrieved during the OAuth2 authentication process.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/dto/request/VariantRequest.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `VariantRequest`, which is a data transfer object (DTO) used for handling variant information in an e-commerce application.\\n\\n`VariantRequest`: A DTO class that represents a variant of a product, including its option name, option value, price, stock, image URL, and SKU.\\n\\nThis file does not contain any functions. It is a simple DTO class that provides a structured way to represent and transfer variant information in the context of an e-commerce application.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/service/VoucherService.java\":\"This file defines an interface `VoucherService` and two nested classes `PlatformVoucherResult` and `StoreVoucherResult` within it.\\n\\n`VoucherService`: An interface that provides methods for computing discounts based on store vouchers and platform vouchers.\\n\\n`computeDiscountByStore`: Computes the discount by store based on the provided store vouchers and store order items.\\n\\n`computeDiscountByStoreWithDetail`: Computes the discount by store with detailed information.\\n\\n`computePlatformDiscounts`: Computes the platform discounts based on the provided platform vouchers and store order items.\\n\\n`PlatformVoucherResult`: A class that holds the results of the platform discount computation, including the discount by store and the platform discount map.\\n\\n`StoreVoucherResult`: A class that holds the results of the store discount computation, including the discount by store and the detailed discount information by store.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/dto/request/RejectProductRequest.java\":\"This file contains a single class:\\n\\n`RejectProductRequest`: A data transfer object (DTO) that represents a request to reject one or more products, with optional reasons for each product.\\n\\nThe file does not contain any functions. Instead, it defines the structure of the `RejectProductRequest` class, which includes the following properties:\\n\\n- `campaignProductIds`: A list of UUIDs representing the IDs of the products to be rejected.\\n- `reason`: A general reason for rejecting the products, if a common reason is applicable.\\n- `reasonMap`: An optional map of UUIDs to strings, allowing for a specific reason to be provided for each rejected product.\\n\\nThis file is part of an e-commerce application that deals with audio-related products, and it provides a way to represent a request to reject one or more products, along with the reasons for the rejection.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/repository/ProductComboRepository.java\":\"This file contains a single interface named `ProductComboRepository` that extends the `JpaRepository` interface.\\n\\n`ProductComboRepository`: This interface provides methods for interacting with the `ProductCombo` entity in the database, including finding `ProductCombo` instances based on the `ComboCreatorType` and `creatorId` fields.\\n\\n`findByCreatorTypeAndCreatorId`: This method retrieves a paginated list of `ProductCombo` instances based on the provided `ComboCreatorType` and `creatorId` parameters.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/security/JwtTokenProvider.java\":\"This file contains a single class `JwtTokenProvider` that provides functionality for generating, validating, and extracting information from JWT (JSON Web Tokens) access and refresh tokens.\\n\\n`JwtTokenProvider`: A class that manages the generation, validation, and extraction of information from JWT access and refresh tokens.\\n\\n`generateToken`: Generates a JWT access token with the provided user information.\\n`generateRefreshToken`: Generates a JWT refresh token with the provided user information.\\n`validateToken`: Validates the provided JWT access token.\\n`validateRefreshToken`: Validates the provided JWT refresh token.\\n`getAuthentication`: Retrieves the Spring Security `Authentication` object from the provided JWT access token.\\n`getRoleFromToken`: Extracts the user role from the provided JWT access token.\\n`getCustomerIdFromToken`: Extracts the customer ID from the provided JWT access token.\\n`getClaimsFromRefreshToken`: Extracts the claims from the provided JWT refresh token.\\n`getAccountIdFromRefreshToken`: Extracts the account ID from the provided JWT refresh token.\\n`getCustomerIdFromRefreshToken`: Extracts the customer ID from the provided JWT refresh token.\\n`getEmailFromRefreshToken`: Extracts the email from the provided JWT refresh token.\\n`getRoleFromRefreshToken`: Extracts the user role from the provided JWT refresh token.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/service/AccountService.java\":\"This file does not contain any classes, but rather an interface named `AccountService` that defines various methods for handling user authentication and registration.\\n\\n`AccountService`: An interface that provides methods for registering and logging in customers, stores, admins, and flat staff, as well as refreshing access tokens.\\n\\n`registerCustomer(RegisterRequest request)`: Registers a new customer account.\\n`loginCustomer(LoginRequest request)`: Logs in a customer.\\n`registerStore(RegisterRequest request)`: Registers a new store account.\\n`loginStore(LoginRequest request)`: Logs in a store.\\n`registerAdmin(RegisterRequest request)`: Registers a new admin account.\\n`loginAdmin(LoginRequest request)`: Logs in an admin.\\n`refreshToken(RefreshTokenRequest request)`: Refreshes an access token.\\n`registerFlatStaff(RegisterRequest request)`: Registers a new flat staff account.\\n`loginFlatStaff(LoginRequest request)`: Logs in a flat staff.\\n`loginStaff(LoginRequest request)`: Logs in a staff member.\",\"/src/main/resources/templates/email/order_confirmed.html\":\"This file appears to be an HTML template for a successful order payment page. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather defines the structure and styling of the page. Here\\u0027s a summary of what the file does:\\n\\nThe file defines the structure and styling of a successful order payment page, including sections for order summary, product details, and shipping information. The content of the page is dynamically generated using Thymeleaf template engine, with placeholders for customer name, order code, payment date, total amount, and order items.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/dto/response/ProductComboResponse.java\":\"This file defines a data transfer object (DTO) for a product combo response in an e-commerce application.\\n\\n`ProductComboResponse`: A class that represents the response data for a product combo, including information about the combo, its items, and the associated store.\\n\\n`Item`: A nested class within `ProductComboResponse` that represents an individual item within the product combo, including the product ID, name, and quantity.\\n\\nThe file does not contain any functions, but rather defines the structure and properties of the `ProductComboResponse` and `Item` classes, which can be used to transfer data between the application\\u0027s layers.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/dto/response/StaffInfo.java\":\"This file contains a single class:\\n\\n`StaffInfo`: A data transfer object (DTO) that represents information about a staff member, including their ID, store ID (which may be null), full name, email, and phone number.\\n\\nThis file does not contain any functions. It is a simple DTO class used to encapsulate and transfer staff information data.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/dto/response/UpdateStoreResponse.java\":\"This file contains a data transfer object (DTO) for the response of an update store operation in an e-commerce application for audio products.\\n\\n`UpdateStoreResponse`: A DTO class that represents the response data for updating a store, including the store\\u0027s ID, name, description, logo, cover image, address, phone number, email, and a list of store addresses.\\n\\n`StoreAddressResponse`: A nested DTO class that represents the response data for a store address, including whether it is the default address, the province, district, and ward codes, the detailed address, and the address location.\\n\\nThe file does not contain any functions, but rather defines the structure and schema of the response data for updating a store in the audio e-commerce application.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/entity/Enum/StoreStatus.java\":\"This file defines an enumeration called `StoreStatus` that represents the different states a store can have in an audio e-commerce application. The enumeration includes the following values:\\n\\n`INACTIVE`: The store is inactive and cannot be accessed by customers.\\n`PENDING`: The store is pending approval and is not yet active.\\n`ACTIVE`: The store is active and can be accessed by customers.\\n`REJECTED`: The store has been rejected and cannot be accessed by customers.\\n`SUSPENDED`: The store has been suspended and cannot be accessed by customers.\\n`PAUSED`: The store has been temporarily paused by the store owner and cannot be accessed by customers.\\n\\nThis file does not contain any classes or functions, but rather defines an enumeration that can be used throughout the application to represent the different states a store can have.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/controller/StoreDeliveryController.java\":\"This file appears to be a Spring Boot controller class for handling the delivery process of an e-commerce application. It provides various endpoints for managing the delivery workflow, including assigning delivery staff, marking orders as ready for pickup, out for delivery, delivered, and denied. The controller also includes endpoints for tracking the delivery staff\\u0027s location and listing delivery assignments.\\n\\n`StoreDeliveryController`: A REST controller class that handles the delivery process for a store\\u0027s orders.\\n\\n`assign`: Assigns a delivery staff and (optionally) a prepared-by staff to a store order.\\n`readyForPickup`: Marks a store order as ready for pickup.\\n`outForDelivery`: Marks a store order as out for delivery.\\n`deliveredWaitingConfirm`: Marks a store order as delivered and waiting for confirmation.\\n`confirmSuccess`: Confirms the successful delivery of a store order.\\n`denyReceive`: Marks a store order as denied by the customer.\\n`pushLocation`: Allows the delivery staff to push their current location.\\n`listAssignments`: Retrieves a list of all delivery assignments for a store.\\n`pageAssignments`: Retrieves a paginated list of delivery assignments for a store.\\n`getAssignment`: Retrieves the details of a specific delivery assignment.\\n`listOfStaff`: Retrieves a list of delivery assignments for a specific staff member.\\n`pageOfStaff`: Retrieves a paginated list of delivery assignments for a specific staff member.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/service/WarrantyService.java\":\"This file defines an interface called `WarrantyService` that provides methods for managing warranties for audio products in an e-commerce application.\\n\\n`WarrantyService`: Defines the contract for managing warranties, including activating warranties, searching for warranties, opening and updating warranty tickets, setting serial numbers, and reviewing warranties.\\n\\n`activateForStoreOrder(UUID storeOrderId)`: Activates the warranty for a store order.\\n\\n`activateSingleItem(org.example.audio_ecommerce.entity.StoreOrderItem item)`: Activates the warranty for a single store order item.\\n\\n`search(WarrantySearchRequest req)`: Searches for warranties based on the provided request.\\n\\n`openTicket(UUID warrantyId, WarrantyLogOpenRequest req)`: Opens a new warranty ticket.\\n\\n`updateTicketStatus(UUID logId, WarrantyLogStatus newStatus, WarrantyLogUpdateRequest req)`: Updates the status of a warranty ticket.\\n\\n`setSerialFirstTime(UUID warrantyId, String serial, String note)`: Sets the serial number for a warranty for the first time.\\n\\n`review(UUID logId, UUID customerId, WarrantyReviewRequest req)`: Allows a customer to review a warranty.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/dto/response/GhnOrderResponse.java\":\"This file contains a single class:\\n\\n`GhnOrderResponse`: A data transfer object (DTO) that represents a response from the GHN (Giao Hng Nhanh) delivery service, containing information about an order, such as the order ID, store ID, total fee, expected delivery time, and status.\\n\\nThis file does not contain any functions. It is a simple DTO class that is used to transfer data between different components of the application.\",\"/src/main/resources/templates/email/welcome_customer.html\":\"This file appears to be an HTML template for a welcome email to a customer of an audio e-commerce website. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather displays a greeting, a call to action, and a closing message.\\n\\nThe file performs the following tasks:\\n\\n1. Displays a greeting to the customer, using a variable `${name}` to personalize the message.\\n2. Welcomes the customer as a new customer of the AudioEcommerce website.\\n3. Provides a link to the website\\u0027s homepage, using the variable `${siteUrl}`.\\n4. Includes a closing message from the AudioEcommerce team.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/dto/request/BulkUpdateCartQtyRequest.java\":\"This file contains a single class `BulkUpdateCartQtyRequest` and a nested static class `Line`.\\n\\n`BulkUpdateCartQtyRequest`: A data transfer object (DTO) that represents a request to update the quantities of multiple items in a shopping cart.\\n\\n`Line`: A nested class within `BulkUpdateCartQtyRequest` that represents a single line item in the cart, including the type of item (product or combo), the reference ID, and the desired quantity.\\n\\nThis file does not contain any functions, but rather defines the structure of the request data for a bulk update of cart item quantities.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/dto/request/WalletTxnRequest.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `WalletTxnRequest`, which is a data transfer object (DTO) used to represent a request for a wallet transaction.\\n\\n`WalletTxnRequest`: A DTO class that represents a request for a wallet transaction, including the transaction amount, description, and optional order ID.\\n\\nThe file does not contain any functions, but rather defines the structure and validation rules for the `WalletTxnRequest` DTO, which is likely used in a larger application context to handle wallet-related transactions.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/service/Impl/GhnOrderServiceImpl.java\":\"This file contains a single class and several functions:\\n\\n`GhnOrderServiceImpl`: This class is an implementation of the `GhnOrderService` interface, which provides functionality for managing GHN (Giao Hng Nhanh) orders.\\n\\n`create`: This function creates a new GHN order based on the provided `CreateGhnOrderRequest` and saves it to the database.\\n`getByStoreOrderId`: This function retrieves a GHN order by its store order ID.\\n`toResp`: This function maps a `GhnOrder` entity to a `GhnOrderResponse` DTO.\\n\\nOverall, this file provides the implementation of a service that handles the creation and retrieval of GHN orders for an e-commerce application.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/controller/AccountController.java\":\"This file is a Spring Boot controller class that handles account-related operations for an e-commerce application.\\n\\n`AccountController`: A REST controller class that provides endpoints for user registration, login, and token refresh.\\n\\n`registerCustomer`: Registers a new customer account.\\n`registerStore`: Registers a new store account.\\n`registerAdmin`: Registers a new admin account.\\n`registerFlatStaff`: Registers a new flat staff account.\\n`loginCustomer`: Authenticates a customer and returns a JWT token.\\n`loginStore`: Authenticates a store and returns a JWT token.\\n`loginAdmin`: Authenticates an admin and returns a JWT token.\\n`loginFlatStaff`: Authenticates a flat staff and returns a JWT token.\\n`refreshToken`: Generates a new JWT token using a valid refresh token.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/repository/WalletTransactionRepository.java\":\"This file contains a Java interface named `WalletTransactionRepository` that extends the `JpaRepository` interface. The purpose of this interface is to provide methods for interacting with the `WalletTransaction` entity in the database.\\n\\n`WalletTransactionRepository`: An interface that provides methods for querying and managing `WalletTransaction` entities in the database.\\n\\n`findByWallet_Customer_IdOrderByCreatedAtDesc`: Retrieves a paginated list of `WalletTransaction` entities for a given customer ID, ordered by the creation date in descending order.\\n\\n`findFirstByWallet_Customer_IdAndOrderIdAndTransactionTypeOrderByCreatedAtDesc`: Retrieves the most recent `WalletTransaction` entity for a given customer ID, order ID, and transaction type, ordered by the creation date in descending order.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/controller/SellBannerController.java\":\"This file contains a Spring Boot REST controller class for managing sell banners in an e-commerce application.\\n\\n`SellBannerController`: A REST controller class that provides CRUD operations for managing sell banners.\\n\\n`createBanner`: Creates a new sell banner with a list of images and a link.\\n`updateBanner`: Updates an existing sell banner by replacing the list of images.\\n`getAllBanners`: Retrieves a list of all sell banners, with an optional filter to only return active banners.\\n`getBannerById`: Retrieves the details of a specific sell banner by its ID.\\n`deleteBanner`: Deletes a sell banner by its ID.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/entity/Enum/VoucherStatus.java\":\"This file defines an enumeration called `VoucherStatus` that represents the different states a voucher can have in an e-commerce application. The enumeration includes the following values:\\n\\n`VoucherStatus`: An enumeration that represents the different states a voucher can have in an e-commerce application, such as draft, active, expired, disabled, approved, open for registration, and rejected.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/dto/request/RefreshTokenRequest.java\":\"This file contains a single class:\\n\\n`RefreshTokenRequest`: A data transfer object (DTO) that represents a request for a new access token using a refresh token.\\n\\nThis file does not contain any functions. It is a simple DTO class that is used to validate and handle the request for a new access token using a refresh token.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/email/OrderData.java\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. Instead, it defines a data class called `OrderData` using the Lombok library. The `OrderData` class represents the data required for an order in an e-commerce application, including the customer\\u0027s email, name, order code, total amount, payment date, receiver\\u0027s name, shipping address, phone number, shipping note, and a list of ordered items.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/entity/Staff.java\":\"This file defines the `Staff` entity class, which is used to represent a staff member in an audio e-commerce application.\\n\\n`Staff`: This class represents a staff member in the audio e-commerce application, with properties such as username, password, full name, email, phone, and associations with a store and an account.\\n\\n`id`: This is the unique identifier for the staff member, generated using a UUID.\\n\\n`username`: This is the username of the staff member.\\n\\n`password`: This is the password of the staff member.\\n\\n`fullName`: This is the full name of the staff member.\\n\\n`email`: This is the email address of the staff member.\\n\\n`phone`: This is the phone number of the staff member.\\n\\n`store`: This is the store that the staff member is associated with.\\n\\n`account`: This is the account that the staff member is associated with.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/entity/Warranty.java\":\"This file defines the `Warranty` entity class for an audio e-commerce application, which represents a warranty associated with a product purchased by a customer from a store.\\n\\n`Warranty`: An entity class that represents a warranty for a product purchased by a customer from a store, with various attributes such as the customer, store, product, serial number, policy code, duration, purchase date, start date, end date, coverage status, warranty status, activation date, and notes.\\n\\n`prePersist()`: A method that automatically sets the start date, end date, and activation date for the warranty when it is being persisted to the database.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/controller/GHNController.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `GHNController`, which is a REST controller that provides various endpoints for interacting with the GHN (Giao Hng Nhanh) shipping service. The controller handles tasks such as retrieving province, district, and ward information, calculating shipping fees, creating and canceling orders, retrieving order details, generating print tokens, and updating COD (Cash on Delivery) amounts.\\n\\n`GHNController`: A REST controller that provides various endpoints for interacting with the GHN shipping service.\\n\\n`createHeaders`: Creates the HTTP headers required for GHN API requests, including the GHN token and shop ID.\\n\\n`getProvinces`: Retrieves the list of provinces from the GHN API.\\n\\n`getDistricts`: Retrieves the list of districts for a given province from the GHN API.\\n\\n`getWards`: Retrieves the list of wards for a given district from the GHN API.\\n\\n`calculateFee`: Calculates the shipping fee for a given order using the GHN API.\\n\\n`createOrder`: Creates a new order in the GHN system using the provided order details.\\n\\n`cancelOrder`: Cancels an existing order in the GHN system.\\n\\n`getOrderDetail`: Retrieves the details of a specific order from the GHN system.\\n\\n`getPickShifts`: Retrieves the list of available pick-up shifts from the GHN API.\\n\\n`generatePrintToken`: Generates a temporary token for printing GHN order labels.\\n\\n`printA5`: Generates and returns a PDF file containing the GHN order label for a given token.\\n\\n`updateCodAmount`: Updates the COD (Cash on Delivery) amount for an existing order in the GHN system.\\n\\n`deliveryAgain`: Requests GHN to redeliver an order that was previously unsuccessful.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/controller/PlatformCampaignController.java\":\"This file contains a Spring Boot controller class for managing platform campaigns in an e-commerce application.\\n\\n`PlatformCampaignController`: A controller class that provides REST API endpoints for managing platform campaigns, including creating, updating, and retrieving campaign information, as well as managing campaign products.\\n\\n`createUnified()`: Allows an admin to create a new campaign (either a Mega Sale or a Fast Sale).\\n`join()`: Allows a store to register products to participate in a campaign.\\n`fastSaleList()`: Retrieves a list of active Fast Sale campaigns.\\n`slotProducts()`: Retrieves the list of products in a specific slot of a Fast Sale campaign.\\n`getAllCampaigns()`: Retrieves a list of all campaigns (both Mega Sale and Fast Sale).\\n`getCampaignProducts()`: Allows an admin to view the list of products in a specific campaign.\\n`approveCampaignProducts()`: Allows an admin to approve products that have been registered for a campaign.\\n`updateCampaignProductStatus()`: Allows an admin to update the status of products in a campaign.\\n`updateCampaign()`: Allows an admin to update the information of a campaign.\\n`getCampaignProductOverviewFiltered()`: Retrieves an overview of campaign products with filtering options.\\n`updateCampaignStatus()`: Allows an admin to update the status of a campaign.\\n`getJoinedCampaigns()`: Retrieves a list of campaigns that a store has joined.\\n`rejectCampaignProducts()`: Allows an admin to reject products that have been registered for a campaign.\\n`getCampaignProductDetails()`: Retrieves detailed information about campaign products based on store, campaign, and status.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/dto/response/SlotProductsResponse.java\":\"This file defines a data transfer object (DTO) for the response of a slot products API endpoint in an audio e-commerce application.\\n\\n`SlotProductsResponse`: A class that represents the response of the slot products API, containing information about the campaign, slot, and a list of items.\\n\\n`Item`: A nested class within `SlotProductsResponse` that represents an individual product item, including details about the product, associated vouchers, and their status.\\n\\nThis file does not contain any functions, but rather defines the structure of the response data that will be returned by the API endpoint.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/controller/CartController.java\":\"This file contains a Spring Boot controller class for managing customer carts in an e-commerce application.\\n\\n`CartController`: A REST controller class that provides various endpoints for managing customer carts, including adding items, checking out, and updating cart contents.\\n\\n`getActive`: Retrieves the active cart for a given customer.\\n`addItems`: Adds one or more items (products or combos) to the customer\\u0027s cart.\\n`checkoutCod`: Processes a checkout request for the items in the customer\\u0027s cart using cash-on-delivery (COD) payment.\\n`checkCodEligibility`: Checks the COD eligibility for a list of items the customer wants to checkout.\\n`updateItemQuantity`: Updates the quantity of a specific item in the customer\\u0027s cart.\\n`removeItems`: Removes one or more items from the customer\\u0027s cart.\\n`clearCart`: Clears all items from the customer\\u0027s active cart.\\n`bulkUpdateQuantities`: Updates the quantities of multiple items in the customer\\u0027s cart at once.\\n`checkoutStoreShip`: Processes a checkout request for the items in the customer\\u0027s cart with store-level shipping.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/email/EmailTemplateResolver.java\":\"This file contains a single class shop, or customer in an e-commerce application.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/repository/StoreWalletTransactionRepository.java\":\"This file is a Spring Data JPA repository interface for managing `StoreWalletTransaction` entities in an audio e-commerce application.\\n\\n`StoreWalletTransactionRepository`: This interface extends the `JpaRepository` interface and provides methods order.\\n\\n`findByWallet_WalletIdAndTypeOrderByCreatedAtDesc`: Retrieves a paginated list of transactions associated with a given wallet ID and transaction type, ordered by creation date in descending order.\\n\\n`filterTransactions`: Retrieves a paginated list of transactions associated with a given wallet ID, filtered by creation date, transaction type, and transaction ID.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/LangChain4J/ProductAiQueryService.java\":\"This file contains a single class and three functions:\\n\\n`ProductAiQueryService`: A service class that provides functionality for searching products based on a natural language question.\\n\\n`searchProduct`: This function takes a natural language question as input, generates an SQL query using the `ProductQueryAgent`, executes the query using the `SqlExecutorTool`, and returns a list of product IDs that match the query.\\n\\nThe file appears to be part of a larger application that uses LangChain4J, a Java implementation of the LangChain framework, to enable natural language-based product search functionality in an e-commerce application.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/entity/Enum/WarrantyLogStatus.java\":\"This file defines an enumeration called `WarrantyLogStatus` that represents the different statuses a warranty log can have in an audio e-commerce application. The enumeration includes the following values:\\n\\n`WarrantyLogStatus`: An enumeration that represents the different statuses a warranty log can have in an audio e-commerce application, such as OPEN, DIAGNOSING, WAITING_PARTS, REPAIRING, READY_FOR_PICKUP, SHIP_BACK, COMPLETED, and CLOSED.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/service/Impl/DeliveryServiceImpl.java\":\"This file contains a service implementation class `DeliveryServiceImpl` that handles various delivery-related operations for an e-commerce application.\\n\\n`DeliveryServiceImpl`: Implements the `DeliveryService` interface and provides methods for managing delivery assignments, tracking delivery status, and synchronizing customer order status.\\n\\n`mustGetStoreOrderOfStore`: Retrieves a `StoreOrder` entity, ensuring that it belongs to the specified store.\\n\\n`assignDeliveryStaff`: Assigns a delivery staff member and a prepared-by staff member to a store order, and updates the order status to \\\"READY_FOR_PICKUP\\\".\\n\\n`markReadyForPickup`: Updates the status of a store order to \\\"READY_FOR_DELIVERY\\\".\\n\\n`markOutForDelivery`: Updates the status of a store order to \\\"OUT_FOR_DELIVERY\\\" and records the pickup time.\\n\\n`markDeliveredWaitingConfirm`: Updates the status of a store order to \\\"DELIVERED_WAITING_CONFIRM\\\" and records the delivery time.\\n\\n`confirmDeliverySuccess`: Confirms the successful delivery of a store order, updates the status to \\\"DELIVERY_SUCCESS\\\", and saves a delivery proof.\\n\\n`markDeliveryDenied`: Updates the status of a store order to \\\"DELIVERY_DENIED\\\" and adds a note to the ship note.\\n\\n`pushLocation`: Saves a delivery location log for a store order and automatically updates the status to \\\"OUT_FOR_DELIVERY\\\" if it was previously \\\"READY_FOR_PICKUP\\\".\\n\\n`listAssignments`: Retrieves a list of delivery assignments for a given store and optional order status.\\n\\n`pageAssignments`: Retrieves a paginated list of delivery assignments for a given store and optional order status, with sorting options.\\n\\n`getAssignment`: Retrieves a specific delivery assignment by its ID, ensuring that it belongs to the specified store.\\n\\n`getStoreOrderEntity`: Retrieves a `StoreOrder` entity by its ID.\\n\\n`syncCustomerOrderStatus`: Synchronizes the status of a customer order based on the status of its associated store orders.\\n\\n`listAssignmentsOfStaff`: Retrieves a list of delivery assignments for a given store and staff member, with optional order status filtering.\\n\\n`pageAssignmentsOfStaff`: Retrieves a paginated list of delivery assignments for a given store and staff member, with optional order status filtering and sorting options.\\n\\n`toDTO`: Converts a `DeliveryAssignment` entity to a `DeliveryAssignmentResponse` DTO.\\n\\n`toItemDTOs`: Converts a list of `StoreOrderItem` entities to a list of `OrderItemResponse` DTOs.\\n\\n`calcOrderTotal`: Calculates the total order amount for a given `StoreOrder` entity.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/entity/StoreKyc.java\":\"This file defines the `StoreKyc` entity, which represents the KYC (Know Your Customer) information for a store in an audio e-commerce application. The entity contains various fields related to the store\\u0027s information, such as the store name, phone number, business license number, bank account details, and KYC status. The file also includes annotations for Jackson JSON serialization and Lombok for generating boilerplate code.\\n\\nThere are no explicit functions defined in this file. The file serves as a data model for the `StoreKyc` entity, which can be used in the application\\u0027s persistence layer.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/service/PlatformCampaignService.java\":\"This file defines an interface called `PlatformCampaignService` that provides methods for managing campaigns and campaign products in an audio e-commerce application.\\n\\n`PlatformCampaignService`: An interface that defines methods for managing campaigns and campaign products.\\n\\n`createCampaignUnified`: Creates a unified campaign (either MEGA_SALE or FAST_SALE).\\n`updateCampaign`: Updates a campaign, including its slots.\\n`joinCampaign`: Allows a store to join a campaign and register products.\\n`getFastSaleCampaigns`: Retrieves a list of FAST_SALE campaigns based on filters.\\n`getSlotProducts`: Retrieves products for a specific slot in a campaign, filtered by time.\\n`tickAllCampaigns`: Performs a periodic task to update the status of all campaigns.\\n`getAllCampaigns`: Retrieves a list of all campaigns based on filters.\\n`getCampaignProducts`: Retrieves a list of products in a campaign, filtered by store, time, and status.\\n`approveCampaignProducts`: Allows an admin to approve campaign products.\\n`updateCampaignProductStatus`: Updates the status of campaign products.\\n`getCampaignProductOverviewFiltered`: Retrieves a filtered overview of campaign products.\\n`updateCampaignStatus`: Updates the status of a campaign.\\n`getJoinedCampaignsByCampaignStatus`: Retrieves a list of campaigns a store has joined, filtered by campaign status and store approval.\\n`rejectCampaignProducts`: Allows an admin to reject campaign products.\\n`getCampaignProductDetails`: Retrieves details of campaign products for a specific store and campaign.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/dto/request/ToggleItemRequest.java\":\"This file contains a single class:\\n\\n`ToggleItemRequest`: A data transfer object (DTO) that represents a request to toggle the selection state of an item.\\n\\nThis file does not contain any functions. It simply defines a DTO class with a single boolean property `selected` to represent the selection state of an item.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/controller/WalletController.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `WalletController`, which is a Spring Boot REST controller that provides APIs for managing a customer\\u0027s electronic wallet, including listing transaction history, depositing, withdrawing, making payments, and processing refunds.\\n\\n`WalletController`: A Spring Boot REST controller that provides APIs for managing a customer\\u0027s electronic wallet.\\n\\n`list`: Retrieves the transaction history for a customer\\u0027s wallet, with support for pagination.\\n\\n`deposit`: Allows a customer to deposit funds into their wallet.\\n\\n`withdraw`: Allows a customer to withdraw funds from their wallet.\\n\\n`payment`: Allows a customer to make a payment from their wallet, with support for idempotency.\\n\\n`refund`: Allows a customer to receive a refund to their wallet.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/controller/CustomerCancellationController.java\":\"This file contains a Spring Boot controller class for handling customer cancellation of orders in an e-commerce application.\\n\\n`CustomerCancellationController`: A REST controller class that provides endpoints for customers to cancel their orders or request cancellation.\\n\\n`cancelWholeOrderIfPending`: Allows a customer to cancel their entire order if it is in the \\\"PENDING\\\" state, and the system will refund the full amount to the customer\\u0027s wallet.\\n\\n`requestCancelStoreOrderByCustomerOrderId`: Allows a customer to request cancellation of a specific store order within their customer order, if the store order is in the \\\"AWAITING_SHIPMENT\\\" state.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/entity/Enum/AddressLabel.java\":\"This file contains an enumeration (enum) called `AddressLabel`, which defines a set of possible address labels. It simply defines an enumeration that can be used to represent different types of addresses in an e-commerce application.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/dto/request/UpdateStoreRequest.java\":\"This file contains a data transfer object (DTO) for updating a store in an e-commerce application. It defines a repository interface that allows for the management of `WarrantyPart` entities in a database using the Spring Data JPA framework.\",\"/src/main/resources/templates/email/account_created.html\":\"This file is an HTML document that serves as a welcome email template for users who have registered an account on the AudioEcommerce platform. Defines the HTML structure with the necessary metadata (charset, title).\\n2. Provides a welcoming message to the user, addressing them by their name.\\n3. query.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/service/StaffService.java\":\"This file defines an interface called `StaffService` that provides methods for managing staff members in an audio not contain any functions. when a new `WarrantyTransfer` entity is created.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/controller/CategoryController.java\":\"This file is a Spring Boot controller class that handles CRUD Here\\u0027s a summary of the classes and functions in the file:\\n\\n`StoreRepository`: An interface that provides methods for performing CRUD operations on the `Store` entity, as well as additional custom queries.\\n\\n`findByAccount_Id(UUID accountId)`: Finds a `Store` entity by the `id` field of the associated `Account` entity.\\n\\n`existsByAccount_Id(UUID accountId)`: Checks if a `Store` entity exists with the given `accountId`.\\n\\n`findByAccount_Email(String email)`: Finds a `Store` entity by the `email` field of the associated `Account` entity.\\n\\n`findAllByStatus(StoreStatus status)`: Retrieves a list of `Store` entities with the given `StoreStatus`.\\n\\n`existsByStoreName(String storeName)`: Checks if a `Store` entity exists with the given `storeName`.\\n\\n`findByStoreId(UUID storeId)`: Finds a `Store` entity by its `storeId`.\\n\\n`findByStoreNameContainingIgnoreCase(String keyword, Pageable pageable)`: Retrieves a paginated list of `Store` entities where the `storeName` contains the given `keyword` (case-insensitive).\\n\\n`findByStoreIdAndStatus(UUID storeId, StoreStatus status)`: Finds a `Store` entity by its `storeId` and `StoreStatus`.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/dto/request/WarrantyReviewRequest.java\":\"This file contains a single class:\\n\\n`WarrantyReviewRequest`: A data transfer object (DTO) that represents a request for a warranty review, containing a rating (1-5) and a comment.\\n\\nThis file does not contain any functions.
