request data.\\n\\n`deleteStoreAddress(int index)`: Deletes the store address at the given index.\\n\\n`setDefaultAddress(int index)`: Sets the store address at the given index as the default address.\\n\\n`getAllAddresses()`: Retrieves all the addresses associated with the store of the currently authenticated user.\\n\\n`ensureSingleDefault(Store store)`: Ensures that there is only one default address for the given store.\\n\\n`getStoreById(UUID storeId)`: Retrieves the store with the given ID.\\n\\n`getStoreByAccountId(UUID accountId)`: Retrieves the store associated with the given account ID.\\n\\n`updateStoreStatus(UUID storeId, StoreStatus status)`: Updates the status of the store with the given ID.\\n\\n`getAllStores(int page, int size, String keyword)`: Retrieves a paginated list of all stores, optionally filtered by a keyword.\\n\\n`getStoreByEmail(String email)`: Retrieves the store associated with the given email.\\n\\n`searchStores(String keyword, int page, int size)`: Searches for stores with a name that starts with the given keyword, and returns a paginated list of the results.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/entity/ComboItem.java\":\"This file defines a JPA entity class `ComboItem` that represents a product item within a product combo. The class has the following properties:\\n\\n`ComboItem`: Represents a product item within a product combo, with an ID, a reference to the parent `ProductCombo`, a reference to the `Product`, and a quantity.\\n\\nThe file does not contain any functions, but rather defines the structure of the `ComboItem` entity, which is used to store information about the individual products that make up a product combo in an e-commerce application.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/service/Impl/PlatformCampaignServiceImpl.java\":\"This file contains the implementation of the `PlatformCampaignService` interface, which provides various functionalities related to managing campaigns and their associated products.\\n\\n`PlatformCampaignServiceImpl`: Implements the `PlatformCampaignService` interface and provides methods for creating, updating, and managing campaigns, as well as handling the registration and approval of campaign products.\\n\\n`createCampaignUnified`: Creates a new campaign with the provided details, including the campaign type, start and end times, and optional flash sale slots.\\n\\n`updateCampaign`: Updates an existing campaign with the provided details, including the campaign name, description, start and end times, and status.\\n\\n`joinCampaign`: Allows a store to join an existing campaign and register its products for the campaign.\\n\\n`getFastSaleCampaigns`: Retrieves a list of fast sale campaigns based on the provided filters.\\n\\n`getSlotProducts`: Retrieves a list of products associated with a specific campaign slot, filtered by their status (expired, ongoing, or upcoming).\\n\\n`getAllCampaigns`: Retrieves a list of all campaigns, filtered by campaign type, status, start time, and end time.\\n\\n`getCampaignProducts`: Retrieves a list of campaign products, filtered by campaign ID, store ID, and status.\\n\\n`updateCampaignStatus`: Updates the status of a campaign.\\n\\n`getCampaignProductOverviewFiltered`: Retrieves an overview of campaign products, filtered by campaign type, status, store ID, and campaign ID.\\n\\n`rejectCampaignProducts`: Rejects the specified campaign products.\\n\\n`getCampaignProductDetails`: Retrieves the details of campaign products, filtered by store ID, campaign ID, and status.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/dto/response/StoreOrderItemResponse.java\":\"This file contains a single data transfer object (DTO) class:\\n\\n`StoreOrderItemResponse`: A DTO class that represents a single item in a store order, containing information such as the item\\u0027s ID, type, reference ID, name, quantity, unit price, and line total.\\n\\nThis file does not contain any functions. It is a simple DTO class used to represent a store order item in the context of an e-commerce application.\",\"/src/main/resources/templates/email/kyc_approved.html\":\"This file appears to be an HTML template for an email or web page that notifies a store owner that their store has been successfully verified (KYC approved). The file does not contain any classes or functions, but rather it displays a greeting, a message about the store\\u0027s verification, and a link to the store management page.\\n\\nThe file performs the following tasks:\\n\\n1. Displays a greeting to the store owner using their name.\\n2. Informs the store owner that their store has been successfully verified.\\n3. Provides a link to the store management page where the store owner can start adding products.\\n4. Includes a closing message from the AudioEcommerce team.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/controller/EmailSendController.java\":\"There are no classes or functions in the provided document. The document appears to be an empty XML document, which does not contain any meaningful content.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/dto/response/PlatformCampaignProductResponse.java\":\"This file contains a single class and one static method:\\n\\n`PlatformCampaignProductResponse`: A data transfer object (DTO) that represents a product associated with a platform campaign, including its details such as product ID, name, original price, discounted price, discount percentage, and approval status.\\n\\n`fromEntity`: A static method that creates a `PlatformCampaignProductResponse` object from a `PlatformCampaignProduct` entity, mapping the entity\\u0027s properties to the DTO\\u0027s properties.\\n\\nThe purpose of this file is to define a DTO for representing a product associated with a platform campaign, which can be used to transfer data between the application\\u0027s layers or to external systems.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/service/Impl/StoreKycServiceImpl.java\":\"This file contains a service implementation class `StoreKycServiceImpl` that handles the business logic related to store KYC (Know Your Customer) management.\\n\\n`StoreKycServiceImpl`: Implements the `StoreKycService` interface and provides methods for submitting, approving, and rejecting store KYC requests, as well as querying the status of KYC requests.\\n\\n`submitKyc`: Allows a store to submit a KYC request, saves the request, updates the store status, and sends a confirmation email to the store owner.\\n\\n`approveKyc`: Approves a KYC request, updates the store status to active, creates a default store wallet if it doesn\\u0027t exist, and sends an approval email to the store owner.\\n\\n`rejectKyc`: Rejects a KYC request, updates the store status to rejected, and sends a rejection email to the store owner.\\n\\n`getAllRequestsOfStore`: Retrieves all KYC requests for a specific store, ordered by creation date.\\n\\n`getRequestDetail`: Retrieves the details of a specific KYC request.\\n\\n`getRequestsByStatus`: Retrieves all KYC requests with a specific status, ordered by submission date.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/config/CloudinaryConfig.java\":\"This file is a Spring configuration class that sets up a Cloudinary client for use in the application.\\n\\n`CloudinaryConfig`: This class configures the Cloudinary client using values from the application\\u0027s properties.\\n\\n`cloudinary()`: This function creates and returns a Cloudinary client instance using the configured values.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/email/dto/KycRejectedData.java\":\"This file contains a single data transfer object (DTO) class:\\n\\n`KycRejectedData`: A DTO class that holds information related to a rejected KYC (Know Your Customer) application, including the email, owner name, store name, rejection reason, and the site URL.\\n\\nThis file does not contain any functions. It is a simple DTO class used to encapsulate and transfer data related to a rejected KYC application in an audio e-commerce application.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/entity/Enum/WarrantyStatus.java\":\"This file defines an enumeration called `WarrantyStatus` that represents the different states a warranty can be in, such as active, expired, void, or transferred.\\n\\nThere are no classes or functions in this file. The file simply defines the `WarrantyStatus` enumeration, which can be used to represent the status of a warranty in an audio e-commerce application.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/config/CategoryInitializer.java\":\"This file is a Spring Boot configuration class that initializes the default categories for an audio e-commerce application.\\n\\n`CategoryInitializer`: This class implements the `CommandLineRunner` interface, which allows it to run a specific piece of code when the application starts up.\\n\\n`run(String... args)`: This function is responsible for seeding the default categories in the database. It checks if the categories already exist, and if not, it creates them with a default description and sort order.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/dto/response/CampaignResponse.java\":\"This file contains a single class `CampaignResponse` and a nested class `FlashSlotDto`. The `CampaignResponse` class represents a response object for a campaign, containing information such as the campaign\\u0027s ID, code, name, description, type, status, and associated flash slots. The `FlashSlotDto` class represents a flash slot within a campaign, containing information about the open and close times, as well as the slot\\u0027s status.\\n\\n`CampaignResponse`: A response object for a campaign, containing information about the campaign and its associated flash slots.\\n\\n`FlashSlotDto`: A data transfer object representing a flash slot within a campaign, containing information about the open and close times, as well as the slot\\u0027s status.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/service/Impl/WarrantyPolicyResolver.java\":\"`WarrantyPolicyResolver`: A class that resolves the warranty period for a given product.\\n\\n`resolveMonths`: A function that takes a `Product` object and returns the warranty period in months, with a default of 12 months if the warranty period is not specified or cannot be parsed.\\n\\nThis file contains a single class, `WarrantyPolicyResolver`, which provides a utility function `resolveMonths` to determine the warranty period for a given `Product` object. The function first checks the `warrantyPeriod` field of the `Product` object, and if it is not null, it attempts to extract the numeric value representing the warranty period in months. If the `warrantyPeriod` field is null or cannot be parsed, the function returns a default value of 12 months.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/service/CustomerService.java\":\"This file defines an interface called `CustomerService` that provides methods for managing customer-related operations in an e-commerce application.\\n\\n`CustomerService`: An interface that defines methods for creating, retrieving, searching, updating, and soft-deleting customer records, as well as managing customer addresses.\\n\\n`create(CustomerCreateRequest req)`: Creates a new customer record based on the provided `CustomerCreateRequest`.\\n`get(UUID id)`: Retrieves a customer record by their unique identifier.\\n`search(String keyword, CustomerStatus status, Pageable pageable)`: Searches for customer records based on a keyword and customer status, with pagination support.\\n`update(UUID id, CustomerUpdateRequest req)`: Updates an existing customer record with the provided `CustomerUpdateRequest`.\\n`softDelete(UUID id)`: Soft-deletes a customer record, marking it as inactive.\\n`listAddresses(UUID customerId)`: Retrieves a list of addresses associated with a customer.\\n`addAddress(UUID customerId, AddressCreateRequest req)`: Adds a new address for a customer.\\n`updateAddress(UUID customerId, UUID addressId, AddressUpdateRequest req)`: Updates an existing address for a customer.\\n`deleteAddress(UUID customerId, UUID addressId)`: Deletes an address associated with a customer.\\n`setDefaultAddress(UUID customerId, UUID addressId)`: Sets a default address for a customer.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/entity/PlatformFee.java\":\"This file defines a JPA entity class `PlatformFee` that represents a platform fee in an e-commerce application.\\n\\n`PlatformFee`: A class that represents a platform fee, including its fee percentage, effective date, description, and status.\\n\\nThe file does not contain any functions, but rather defines the properties and annotations for the `PlatformFee` entity class, which is used to persist platform fee data in a database.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/scheduler/WalletReleaseScheduler.java\":\"This file contains a single class and several functions. Here\\u0027s the summary:\\n\\n`WalletReleaseScheduler`: A class that handles the scheduled release of held funds for customer orders.\\n\\n`releaseHeldFunds()`: A scheduled function that scans for expired holding transactions, checks the status of the corresponding customer orders, and releases the held funds if the order is not cancelled or unpaid.\\n\\nThis file is responsible for the scheduled release of held funds for customer orders in an e-commerce application. It checks for expired holding transactions, verifies the order status, and releases the funds accordingly.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/dto/request/RemoveCartItemRequest.java\":\"This file contains a single class:\\n\\n`RemoveCartItemRequest`: A data transfer object (DTO) that represents a request to remove one or more items from a shopping cart, identified by their unique UUIDs.\\n\\nThe file does not contain any functions. It is a simple DTO class that allows for the removal of one or more cart items by providing a list of their unique identifiers.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/entity/ProductCombo.java\":\"This file defines the `ProductCombo` entity, which represents a product combo in an e-commerce application. The entity has various fields to store information about the combo, such as the store that created it, the products included in the combo, the combo\\u0027s details, media, logistics information, and metadata like creation and update timestamps.\\n\\n`ProductCombo`: An entity that represents a product combo in an e-commerce application, with fields to store information about the combo, such as the store that created it, the products included, and various other details.\\n\\nThere are no functions defined in this file, as it is an entity class.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/service/StoreService.java\":\"This file defines an interface called `StoreService` that provides methods for managing stores and their addresses in an e-commerce application.\\n\\n`StoreService`: Provides methods for managing stores and their addresses in an e-commerce application.\\n\\n`getStoreById`: Retrieves a store by its ID.\\n`getStoreByAccountId`: Retrieves a store by the account ID.\\n`updateStore`: Updates the details of a store.\\n`updateStoreStatus`: Updates the status of a store.\\n`getAllStores`: Retrieves a list of all stores, with optional pagination and filtering.\\n`getStoreByEmail`: Retrieves a store by its email address.\\n`getAllAddresses`: Retrieves all the addresses associated with the current user\\u0027s store.\\n`addStoreAddress`: Adds a new address to the current user\\u0027s store.\\n`updateStoreAddress`: Updates an existing address of the current user\\u0027s store.\\n`deleteStoreAddress`: Deletes an address from the current user\\u0027s store.\\n`setDefaultAddress`: Sets a default address for the current user\\u0027s store.\\n`searchStores`: Searches for stores based on a keyword, with optional pagination.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/repository/StoreWalletRepository.java\":\"This file contains a repository interface for the `StoreWallet` entity and its related `StoreWalletTransaction` entity.\\n\\n`StoreWalletRepository`: This interface extends the `JpaRepository` interface and provides methods for interacting with the `StoreWallet` entity in the database.\\n\\n`findByStore_StoreId(UUID storeId)`: This method finds the `StoreWallet` entity associated with the given store ID.\\n\\n`existsByStore_StoreId(UUID storeId)`: This method checks if a `StoreWallet` entity exists for the given store ID.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/service/Impl/SettlementService.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `SettlementService`, which is responsible for handling various financial transactions and settlement processes related to an e-commerce platform.\\n\\n`SettlementService`: This class manages the financial aspects of the e-commerce platform, including customer payments, platform wallet management, store wallet management, and order refunds.\\n\\n`recordCustomerQrPayment`: This function records a successful customer QR code payment and updates the customer\\u0027s wallet.\\n\\n`moveToPlatformHold`: This function moves the payment amount from a customer\\u0027s order to the platform\\u0027s pending balance, holding it for a specified period.\\n\\n`allocateToStoresPending`: This function allocates the payment amount from a customer\\u0027s order to the respective store\\u0027s pending balance.\\n\\n`releaseAfterHold`: This function releases the held payment amount from the platform\\u0027s pending balance to the respective stores\\u0027 available balances after the hold period.\\n\\n`refundEntireOrderToCustomerWallet`: This function refunds the entire amount of a customer\\u0027s order back to the customer\\u0027s wallet.\\n\\n`refundStorePartToCustomerWallet`: This function refunds a partial amount of a customer\\u0027s order (related to a specific store) back to the customer\\u0027s wallet.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/repository/AiQueryRepository.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `AiQueryRepository`, which is a Spring Repository class responsible for executing SQL queries and returning a list of `UUID` values representing product IDs.\\n\\n`AiQueryRepository`: A Spring Repository class that executes SQL queries and returns a list of product IDs.\\n\\n`executeQuery(String sql)`: A method that takes an SQL query as input, performs some security checks, and then executes the query using a `JdbcTemplate`, returning a list of `UUID` values representing the product IDs.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/service/Impl/VoucherServiceImpl.java\":\"This file is a Java implementation of the `VoucherService` interface, which provides methods for computing discounts for store vouchers and platform vouchers in an e-commerce application.\\n\\n`VoucherServiceImpl`: Implements the `VoucherService` interface and provides methods for computing discounts for store vouchers and platform vouchers.\\n\\n`computeDiscountByStore`: Computes the discounts for a list of store vouchers and returns a map of store IDs and their corresponding discounts.\\n\\n`computePlatformDiscounts`: Computes the discounts for a list of platform vouchers and returns a `PlatformVoucherResult` object containing the discounts by store and the total platform discounts.\\n\\n`computeDiscountByStoreWithDetail`: Computes the discounts for a list of store vouchers and returns a `StoreVoucherResult` object containing the discounts by store and the detailed discounts by voucher code.\\n\\n`eligibleSubtotal`: Calculates the eligible subtotal for a given voucher and list of store order items.\\n\\n`discountOf`: Calculates the discount amount for a given voucher and subtotal.\\n\\n`matchesCampaignProduct`: Checks if a store order item matches a given platform campaign product.\\n\\n`proportionalAllocate`: Allocates a given discount amount proportionally among a set of store subtotals.\",\"/src/main/java/org/example/audio_ecommerce/dto/response/CampaignWithSlotsResponse.java\":\"This file defines a data transfer object (DTO) for a campaign with slots in an audio e-commerce application.\\n\\n`CampaignWithSlotsResponse`: A DTO that represents a campaign with associated slots, including information about the campaign, its status, and the slots.\\n\\n`SlotDto`: A nested DTO that represents a single slot within a campaign, including its ID, open and close times, and status.\\n\\nThe file does not contain any functions, but rather defines the structure of the `CampaignWithSlotsResponse` and `SlotDto` classes, which are likely used to transfer data between the application\\u0027s layers or to external clients.\"}"}
